analyzed: thog min zhes pa ni ma skyes pa'o //
translated: Not beginning means not arisen.

original: thog ma zhes pa ni skyes pa ste /
analyzed: thog ma zhes pa ni skyes pa ste /
translated: Beginning means arisen.

original: de gnyis spangs pa ni bral ba'o //
analyzed: de gnyis spangs pa ni bral ba'o //
translated: The abandonment of those two is freedom.

original: yod pa nyid ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa nyid kyis /🔽yang dag pa ma yin pa la kun brtags pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: yod pa nyid ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa nyid kyis / yang dag pa ma yin pa la kun brtags pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: Existence is the imagined state, due to the clinging to grasped and grasper.

original: med pa nyid ni de gnyis med pa nyid kyis yongs su grub pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: med pa nyid ni de gnyis med pa nyid kyis yongs su grub pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: Nonexistence is the perfected state, due to the nonexistence of those two.

original: mig la sogs pa gzugs la 'jug pa ni dbang por bcas zhes pa ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa gzugs la 'jug pa ni dbang por bcas zhes pa ste /
translated: The engagement of the eye, etc. in form is called together with the sense faculties.

original: dbang por bcas pa ni rgya che ba'i gzugs so //
analyzed: dbang por bcas pa ni rgya che ba'i gzugs so //
translated: The sense faculties are the extensive form.

original: mig la sogs pa 'jug pa ni rnam par shes pa log pa'i dbang po med pa ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa 'jug pa ni rnam par shes pa log pa'i dbang po med pa ste /
translated: The engagement of the eye, etc. is the sense faculty that is the reversal of consciousness.

original: sbrul gnyid log pa'i sgra lta bu kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: sbrul gnyid log pa'i sgra lta bu kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: It is the aspect of the foundation consciousness, like the sound of a sleeping snake.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad brjod de /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad brjod de /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: gang zhig khyod kyis nga la srid pa de lta bur 'gyur ba ma mthong zhes pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhig khyod kyis nga la srid pa de lta bur 'gyur ba ma mthong zhes pa ste /
translated: “You have not seen me in such a way as you think.”

original: 'di nyid gsungs pa ma mthong zhes pa la sogs pa'o//
analyzed: 'di nyid gsungs pa ma mthong zhes pa la sogs pa'o//
translated: This is what is being said: “You have not seen me, etc.”

original: gang rnams kyis ma mthong zhes pa la gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang rnams kyis ma mthong zhes pa la gsungs pa /
translated: As for “by whom have I not been seen,” it is said:

original: 'byung po kun gyis zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung po kun gyis zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “By all beings,” etc.

original: 'byung po ni sems can te de rnams kyis ma mthong ba ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pas kyang yang dag par ma rig pa ste /
analyzed: 'byung po ni sems can te de rnams kyis ma mthong ba ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pas kyang yang dag par ma rig pa ste /
translated: Beings are sentient beings. They have not seen me, not known me with the consciousnesses of the eye, etc.

original: phra ba la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi bdag nyid kyis te /
analyzed: phra ba la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi bdag nyid kyis te /
translated: By the nature of the qualities of subtlety, etc.

original: drug @67b pa'i don gyi bdun pa'o //
analyzed: drug @67b pa'i don gyi bdun pa'o //
translated: The seventh case is the meaning of the sixth case.

original: de kho na de'i rnam par dbye ba brjod bya mang du yod kyang gzhung nyung dus rgyas par bstan par mi nus te /
analyzed: de kho na de'i rnam par dbye ba brjod bya mang du yod kyang gzhung nyung dus rgyas par bstan par mi nus te /
translated: Although there are many topics of expression in the divisions of that reality, it cannot be taught extensively by a short text.

original: rgyud 'di gzhung nyung la don rgyas par dgongs zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: rgyud 'di gzhung nyung la don rgyas par dgongs zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: It is thought that this Tantra is intended to have a short text but an extensive meaning.

original: gal te yang de la dga' bas bstan par mi nus te /
analyzed: gal te yang de la dga' bas bstan par mi nus te /
translated: Even if one is not able to teach it out of love for it,

original: 'on kyang man ngag tsam gyis bstan pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'on kyang man ngag tsam gyis bstan pa nyid de /
translated: nevertheless, it is taught just by the oral instructions.

original: de la gzhung mang bas 'jigs pas mdor bsdus nas bstan pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de la gzhung mang bas 'jigs pas mdor bsdus nas bstan pa gsungs pa /
translated: There, fearing a long text, it is taught in brief.

original: rnal 'byor lam gyis zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor lam gyis zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is said, “by the path of yoga,” and so on.

original: rnal 'byor zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems bsgoms pa la sogs pa'i rtsi'i 'o ma yongs su grub pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs ye shes dbyer med pa'i bdag nyid kyi lha'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems bsgoms pa la sogs pa'i rtsi'i 'o ma yongs su grub pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs ye shes dbyer med pa'i bdag nyid kyi lha'i rnam pa'o //
translated: “ Yoga” is the form of the deity, the nature of the indivisible body, speech, and mind exalted wisdoms, the body of the milk of the elixir of the meditation of the thought of enlightenment, and so on.

original: de bzhin du yang 'khor lo sdom pa las gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang 'khor lo sdom pa las gsungs pa /
translated: Also, it is stated in the Cakrasamvara Tantra:

original: ye shes phyag rgya snyoms 'jug rnal 'byor gyi //
analyzed: ye shes phyag rgya snyoms 'jug rnal 'byor gyi //
translated: “The yoga is the meditative stabilization of the exalted wisdom seal.”

original: zhes brjod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes brjod pa'o //
translated: It is said.

original: lam de bsgom nus pa des mthong bar 'gyur zhing so sor snang ba dang shes shing mngon sum du 'gyur zhes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: lam de bsgom nus pa des mthong bar 'gyur zhing so sor snang ba dang shes shing mngon sum du 'gyur zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: “One who is able to cultivate that path will see, will individually experience, will understand, will perceive, up to will manifest.”

original: mang du brjod pas ci zhig dgos te /
analyzed: mang du brjod pas ci zhig dgos te /
translated: What is the use of speaking much?

original: khyod de kho na gang la dga' ba shes par gyis par dgongs te /
analyzed: khyod de kho na gang la dga' ba shes par gyis par dgongs te /
translated: One should understand that you are pleased with reality,

original: rnal 'byor gyi lam gyis mthong bar 'gyur zhes gsungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi lam gyis mthong bar 'gyur zhes gsungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: and it is said that “one will see by the path of yoga.”

original: rnal 'byor de rnam pa du zhig ces pa la gsungs pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor de rnam pa du zhig ces pa la gsungs pa /
translated: How many kinds of yoga are there? It is said:

original: rnam pa gnyis zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Two kinds,” and so on.

original: lha'i rnam par bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor rnam pa gnyis dngos grub kyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i rnam par bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor rnam pa gnyis dngos grub kyi rnam pa'o //
translated: The yoga of meditating on the form of the deity has two kinds, which are the aspects of power.

original: gang gi dbye bas rnam gnyis zhes pa la gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gi dbye bas rnam gnyis zhes pa la gsungs pa /
translated: By what division are there two kinds? It is said:

original: phyi dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “External and internal,” and so on.

original: phyi ni bum pa dang gos dang rtsig pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ni bum pa dang gos dang rtsig pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: External is a vase, a cloth, a wall, and so on.

original: nang ni phung po lnga'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: nang ni phung po lnga'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Internal is the nature of the five aggregates.

original: 'dis ni lha rnams dmigs pa'i yul du gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dis ni lha rnams dmigs pa'i yul du gsungs so //
translated: This teaches the object of observation of the deities.

original: de bzhin du yang bde mchog las gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang bde mchog las gsungs pa /
translated: Likewise, it is also stated in the Heruka Tantra:

original: de nyid med pa'i rnal 'byor sems //
analyzed: de nyid med pa'i rnal 'byor sems //
translated: The mind of the yogin who lacks reality

original: lha ru dmigs par rtogs pa ste //
analyzed: lha ru dmigs par rtogs pa ste //
translated: is imagined as the deity.

original: gzugs brnyan rang bzhin rnal 'byor dag / dbang bskur la sogs skye ba ste //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan rang bzhin rnal 'byor dag / dbang bskur la sogs skye ba ste //
translated: The nature of the reflection is the yoga of consecration, etc.

original: shin tu de nyid sems rnal 'byor ;
analyzed: shin tu de nyid sems rnal 'byor ;
translated: The mind of reality is

original: ; nang gi rnal 'byor zhes brjod do //
analyzed: ; nang gi rnal 'byor zhes brjod do //
translated: called the inner yoga.

original: zhes pa'o // de la phyi'i rnal 'byor nye bar bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de la phyi'i rnal 'byor nye bar bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In order to teach the outer yoga, he says:

original: phyi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The outer is form, etc.

original: nang la ltos nas phyi'o //
analyzed: nang la ltos nas phyi'o //
translated: The outer is in relation to the inner.

original: gzugs ni kha dog dbyibs kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs ni kha dog dbyibs kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: Form is the nature of color and shape.

original: dbyibs ni gru bzhi la sogs pa ste thams cad gcig tu @68a * //
analyzed: dbyibs ni gru bzhi la sogs pa ste thams cad gcig tu @68a * //
translated: Shape is square, etc.

original: 'dus pa'i gzugs kyi phung po zhes rnam par gzhag pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dus pa'i gzugs kyi phung po zhes rnam par gzhag pa bstan to //
translated: The aggregate of form is taught to be the collection of all.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni dri la sogs pa yang gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni dri la sogs pa yang gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The word “etc.” includes smell, etc.

original: de yang 'byung ba'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: de yang 'byung ba'i rnam pa ste /
translated: That is also the aspect of the elements.

original: 'byung ba yang sa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba yang sa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The elements are earth, etc.

original: de rnams ni khams kyi rtsa sra ba la sogs pa'i cha shas so //
analyzed: de rnams ni khams kyi rtsa sra ba la sogs pa'i cha shas so //
translated: Those are the parts of the solid channels and so forth of the elements.🔽Are they just those? Or are there others?

original: ci 'di dag tsam nyid dam gzhan yang zhes pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci 'di dag tsam nyid dam gzhan yang zhes pa gsungs pa /
translated: He says,

original: 'dus byas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “conditioned” and so forth.

original: 'dus byas ni shing bzo mkhan la sogs pas nan tan du bcos legs kyi las kyi rim pas lha'i gzugs brnyan byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas ni shing bzo mkhan la sogs pas nan tan du bcos legs kyi las kyi rim pas lha'i gzugs brnyan byas pa'o //
translated: Conditioned means that a divine image is made by a carpenter and so forth, through the stages of the work of careful construction.

original: de ru gzugs 'byung ste rim par bsgoms shing legs par byas pa ni 'dus byas rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ru gzugs 'byung ste rim par bsgoms shing legs par byas pa ni 'dus byas rdzogs pa ste /
translated: There, the form arises, and through being cultivated in stages and well made, it is the completion of the conditioned.

original: lha la dmigs pa'i rnam pa ni phyi'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: lha la dmigs pa'i rnam pa ni phyi'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: The aspect of the focus on the deity is the outer yoga.🔽The inner yoga is the arising through the application of the channels in one’s own body, and the completion through the stages of the conditioned.

original: nang gi rnal 'byor ni rang gi lus la rtsa'i rab tu sbyor bas skye zhing rim par 'dus byas pas rdzogs pa ni lha'i gzugs su ma gsungs kyang go bar bya'o //
analyzed: nang gi rnal 'byor ni rang gi lus la rtsa'i rab tu sbyor bas skye zhing rim par 'dus byas pas rdzogs pa ni lha'i gzugs su ma gsungs kyang go bar bya'o //
translated: Although the form of the deity is not mentioned, it should be understood.

original: ci gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po gang gis 'dir rnal 'byor gyi dmigs pa'i rten byed pa nyid kyis bsgom pa'i yan lag tu brjod dam zhes pa la gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po gang gis 'dir rnal 'byor gyi dmigs pa'i rten byed pa nyid kyis bsgom pa'i yan lag tu brjod dam zhes pa la gsungs pa /
translated: What is it that is called a branch of meditation by the function of being the basis of the yogi's object of meditation, the aggregates of form, etc.?

original: brten pa la sogs pa ste 'dis ni thams cad bsgom pa'i bdag nyid ni rnal 'byor pa zhes bsdu bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brten pa la sogs pa ste 'dis ni thams cad bsgom pa'i bdag nyid ni rnal 'byor pa zhes bsdu bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The answer is: The supported, etc. By this, it is summarized that the nature of all is meditation, and the yogi.

original: de bzhin du yang bde mchog las gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang bde mchog las gsungs pa /
translated: Likewise, it is also stated in the Heruka Tantra:

original: 'di ni thams cad bsgoms pas 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di ni thams cad bsgoms pas 'gyur //
translated: This is the meditation of all.

original: zhes pa'o // snod ni ri la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // snod ni ri la sogs pa'o //
translated: The vessel is the mountain, etc.

original: g-yo ba ni mig la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: g-yo ba ni mig la sogs pa'o //
translated: The moving is the eye, etc.

original: sna tshogs zhes pa ni 'gro ba mtha' dag go //
analyzed: sna tshogs zhes pa ni 'gro ba mtha' dag go //
translated: The various is the whole world.

original: khams gsum zhes pa ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams so //
analyzed: khams gsum zhes pa ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams so //
translated: The three realms is the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.

original: ma lus zhes pa ni gang gi phyir gyi don te lnga pa'o //
analyzed: ma lus zhes pa ni gang gi phyir gyi don te lnga pa'o //
translated: The word 'all' has the meaning of 'because', the fifth case.

original: gang gi phyir snod bcud la sogs pa ma lus pa la stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis khyab pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir snod bcud la sogs pa ma lus pa la stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis khyab pa'o //
translated: Because the whole world is pervaded by the nature of emptiness.

original: gang gis khyab ces pa la gsungs pa /🔽de nyid ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis khyab ces pa la gsungs pa / de nyid ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: He says:🔽That itself, etc.

original: de zhes pa ni de kho na nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de zhes pa ni de kho na nyid kyis so //
translated: That means by reality.

original: gcig pus zhes pa ni phyi'i don med pas gnyis pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gcig pus zhes pa ni phyi'i don med pas gnyis pa med pa'o //
translated: Alone means that there is no second because there are no external objects.

original: thams cad rnam par shes pa nyid ces pa ni /
analyzed: thams cad rnam par shes pa nyid ces pa ni /
translated: Everything is consciousness only.

original: khams gsum thams cad kyang rnam par shes pa tsam nyid do //
analyzed: khams gsum thams cad kyang rnam par shes pa tsam nyid do //
translated: Everything in the three realms is consciousness only.

original: de nas dngos po thams cad kyi sems nyid kyis bsgom bya'i dngos po thams cad kyang yongs su 'gyur zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de nas dngos po thams cad kyi sems nyid kyis bsgom bya'i dngos po thams cad kyang yongs su 'gyur zhes pa ste /
translated: Then, since everything is mind only, all objects of meditation are also transformed.

original: snod la sogs pa bsgom byar dmigs @68b pa nyid kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: snod la sogs pa bsgom byar dmigs @68b pa nyid kyis gsungs pa /
translated: He says that the objects of meditation, such as the realm of beings, are imagined.

original: de gsungs par gyur pa gang gi phyir snod bcud la sogs pa la des khyab pas na khams gsum yang rnam par shes pa tsam ste /
analyzed: de gsungs par gyur pa gang gi phyir snod bcud la sogs pa la des khyab pas na khams gsum yang rnam par shes pa tsam ste /
translated: Since it is said that everything is pervaded by mind only, the three realms are consciousness only.

original: de'i phyir bstan pa la sogs pa lha rnams su sbyar ba rigs zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan pa la sogs pa lha rnams su sbyar ba rigs zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to apply the teachings about the deities, etc.

original: gal te thams cad de'i rang bzhin yin na thams cad de'i rnam par 'jig rten pa rnams kyis ci ste ma shes zhes pa la gsungs pa /
analyzed: gal te thams cad de'i rang bzhin yin na thams cad de'i rnam par 'jig rten pa rnams kyis ci ste ma shes zhes pa la gsungs pa /
translated: If everything is of that nature, why don’t worldly people know everything in that way?

original: gang phyir zhes pa la sogs pa'i rgyus te /
analyzed: gang phyir zhes pa la sogs pa'i rgyus te /
translated: The reason is stated in the verse beginning with “because.”

original: kun gyi bdag nyid ni dngos po thams cad kyi'o //
analyzed: kun gyi bdag nyid ni dngos po thams cad kyi'o //
translated: The nature of all is the nature of all things.

original: bdag nyid ces pa ni rang gi rnam par shes pa'i phung po ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid ces pa ni rang gi rnam par shes pa'i phung po ste /
translated: The nature is one’s own aggregate of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa drug gi tshogs la brten pas rang rig pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug gi tshogs la brten pas rang rig pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: It is based on the collection of the six consciousnesses, by the method of reflexive awareness.

original: de'i phyir mi shes pa ni gti mug gi skyes bu ste rigs pa thams cad la spyan la sogs pa rnams kyis ma rtogs pa ni gti mug dang bcas pas mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi shes pa ni gti mug gi skyes bu ste rigs pa thams cad la spyan la sogs pa rnams kyis ma rtogs pa ni gti mug dang bcas pas mi shes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the ignorant person is born from delusion. The eyes and so on of all reasonings do not realize it. Ignorance is not knowing because of delusion.

original: gal te mi shes na sems kyis de kho na nyid ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur zhes pa la gsungs pa /
analyzed: gal te mi shes na sems kyis de kho na nyid ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur zhes pa la gsungs pa /
translated: If it is not known, how can the mind realize reality?

original: sems zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The verse begins with “mind.”

original: sems rang sems kyi tshul gyis bdag nyid kyis zhes pa ni sems pa'o //
analyzed: sems rang sems kyi tshul gyis bdag nyid kyis zhes pa ni sems pa'o //
translated: The mind is the mind itself by the method of the mind. It is the thinker.

original: sems kyi tshul zhes pa ni thams cad du dga' ba dang mi dga' ba dang / phung po la sogs pa rig pa'i bdag nyid kyi srog go //
analyzed: sems kyi tshul zhes pa ni thams cad du dga' ba dang mi dga' ba dang / phung po la sogs pa rig pa'i bdag nyid kyi srog go //
translated: The “way of the mind” is the life-force of the nature of awareness, such as the aggregates, which is everywhere, whether pleasant or unpleasant.

original: shes dang zhes pa ni thams cad du song bas khyab 'jug ste ;
analyzed: shes dang zhes pa ni thams cad du song bas khyab 'jug ste ;
translated: “Consciousness” is Viṣṇu, who pervades everywhere.

original: shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi skyes bu'o //🔽shes bya'i rang bzhin zhes pa ni /
analyzed: shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi skyes bu'o // shes bya'i rang bzhin zhes pa ni /
translated: He is the person whose nature is consciousness.

original: shed bu dang shed las skyes rang rig pa po dang byed pa po la sogs pa'i rdzas kyi gzugs so //
analyzed: shed bu dang shed las skyes rang rig pa po dang byed pa po la sogs pa'i rdzas kyi gzugs so //
translated: “The nature of the object of knowledge” is the substantial form of the person, such as the one born from the womb, the one born from a womb, the one who is self-aware, and the one who is the agent.

original: rgyud nyid ces pa ni dbang phyug nyid de de dbang phyug tu smra ba rnams chos rnams kyi rgyu ni dbang phyug nyid ces smra'o //
analyzed: rgyud nyid ces pa ni dbang phyug nyid de de dbang phyug tu smra ba rnams chos rnams kyi rgyu ni dbang phyug nyid ces smra'o //
translated: “The nature of the continuum” is Īśvara. Those who propound Īśvara say that the cause of phenomena is Īśvara.

original: chos kyi dngos bdag ces pa ni zhi ba'i grub mtha' ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dngos bdag ces pa ni zhi ba'i grub mtha' ste /
translated: “The nature of the entity of phenomena” is the conclusion of peace.

original: bsod nams la sogs pa'i chos rab tu 'phel ba ni /
analyzed: bsod nams la sogs pa'i chos rab tu 'phel ba ni /
translated: The great increase of phenomena, such as merit,

original: chos kyi gzugs kyi dbang phyug chen po ste zhes dbang phyug chen por blta'o //
analyzed: chos kyi gzugs kyi dbang phyug chen po ste zhes dbang phyug chen por blta'o //
translated: is the great Īśvara of the form of phenomena. Thus, he is seen as the great Īśvara.

original: de kho na nyid rab tu bstan pa'i don du 'dis rdzas su mthun pa dang ldog pa gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid rab tu bstan pa'i don du 'dis rdzas su mthun pa dang ldog pa gsungs pa ste /
translated: This is stated in order to teach reality.🔽The terms “established by oneness and manyness” and “established by oneness and manyness” are synonyms.🔽The terms “probandum” and “prover” are synonyms.🔽The terms “probandum” and “property of the subject” are synonyms.🔽The terms “example” and “illustration” are synonyms.

original: gcig nyid dang du ma nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang / gtan tshigs dang dpe rnams gsungs pa'i chos rnams zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gcig nyid dang du ma nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang / gtan tshigs dang dpe rnams gsungs pa'i chos rnams zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The terms “established by oneness and manyness” and “established by oneness and manyness” are synonyms.🔽The terms “probandum” and “prover” are synonyms.🔽The terms “probandum” and “property of the subject” are synonyms.🔽The terms “example” and “illustration” are synonyms.

original: du ma nyid kyis zhes pa'i tshig gis gcig nyid bsgrub bya ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs gsungs so //
analyzed: du ma nyid kyis zhes pa'i tshig gis gcig nyid bsgrub bya ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs gsungs so //
translated: The terms “established by oneness and manyness” and “established by oneness and manyness” are synonyms.🔽The terms “probandum” and “prover” are synonyms.🔽The terms “probandum” and “property of the subject” are synonyms.

original: du ma nyid du mi @69a * //
analyzed: du ma nyid du mi @69a * //
translated: The terms “example” and “illustration” are synonyms.🔽The terms “established by oneness and manyness” and “established by oneness and manyness” are synonyms.🔽The terms “probandum” and “prover” are synonyms.

original: 'byung zhes pa 'dis du ma nyid bsgrub bya'i chos su mi 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs gsungs so //
analyzed: 'byung zhes pa 'dis du ma nyid bsgrub bya'i chos su mi 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs gsungs so //
translated: The terms “probandum” and “property of the subject” are synonyms.🔽The terms “example” and “illustration” are synonyms.🔽The terms “established by oneness and manyness” and “established by oneness and manyness” are synonyms.

original: chu bo'i rgya mtsho'i dpe nyid kyang gnyis ka'i dper bzhed de /
analyzed: chu bo'i rgya mtsho'i dpe nyid kyang gnyis ka'i dper bzhed de /
translated: The terms “probandum” and “prover” are synonyms.🔽The terms “probandum” and “property of the subject” are synonyms.🔽The terms “example” and “illustration” are synonyms.🔽The terms “established by oneness and manyness” and “established by oneness and manyness” are synonyms.🔽The terms “probandum” and “prover” are synonyms.🔽The terms “probandum” and “property of the subject” are synonyms.🔽The terms “example” and “illustration” are synonyms.🔽The terms “established by oneness and manyness” and “established by oneness and manyness” are synonyms.🔽The terms “probandum” and “prover” are synonyms.🔽The terms “probandum” and “property of the subject” are synonyms.🔽The terms “example” and “illustration” are synonyms.

original: 'dis ni du ma nyid dang gcig nyid bsgrub bya'i dper brjod par bya ste /🔽de la sna tshogs nyid ma grub pas gang zhig de ma thag tu gsungs pa'i sems la sogs pa'i chos du ma rnams ji ltar 'grub /
analyzed: 'dis ni du ma nyid dang gcig nyid bsgrub bya'i dper brjod par bya ste /🔽de la sna tshogs nyid ma grub pas gang zhig de ma thag tu gsungs pa'i sems la sogs pa'i chos du ma rnams ji ltar 'grub /
translated: The terms “established by oneness and manyness” and “

original: du ma'i dngos po ni gcig las log pa sna tshogs pa'i rnam par yod pa ste /
analyzed: du ma'i dngos po ni gcig las log pa sna tshogs pa'i rnam par yod pa ste /
translated: A thing that is manifold is present in a variety of forms that are the opposite of one.

original: des na chos du ma nyid kyi rgyus mu stegs sems pa la sogs pa du ma'i rnam par snang ngo //
analyzed: des na chos du ma nyid kyi rgyus mu stegs sems pa la sogs pa du ma'i rnam par snang ngo //
translated: Therefore, due to the cause of the manifoldness of phenomena, the mind appears in a variety of forms, such as the mind of the tīrthikas.

original: 'di lta bur nye bar dmigs pa ci 'dra zhes pa la gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di lta bur nye bar dmigs pa ci 'dra zhes pa la gsungs pa /
translated: As for what is observed in this way, it is said:

original: chu bo'i rgyun zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chu bo'i rgyun zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The flow of a river, and so forth.

original: rgyun gyi sgra 'di ni sdud pa po //
analyzed: rgyun gyi sgra 'di ni sdud pa po //
translated: The word “flow” here is a contraction.

original: rgya mtsho ji ltar chu bo rnams 'bab pa ni si ta dang / sindhu dang / gang g'a la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho ji ltar chu bo rnams 'bab pa ni si ta dang / sindhu dang / gang g'a la sogs pa'o //
translated: A river is what flows, such as the Sita, the Sindhu, and the Ganges.

original: rgyun ni chu bo'i rab tu 'bab pa ste /🔽'bab pas 'di ni chu bo sindhu dang / 'di ni si ta'o //
analyzed: rgyun ni chu bo'i rab tu 'bab pa ste / 'bab pas 'di ni chu bo sindhu dang / 'di ni si ta'o //
translated: A flow is the flowing of a river.

original: 'di ni gang g'a'o zhes sna tshogs su dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ni gang g'a'o zhes sna tshogs su dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Because of flowing, it is not observed in a variety of ways, such as “This is the Sindhu, this is the Sita, and this is the Ganges.”

original: de bzhin du zab cing gting dpag par dka' ba'i chos kyi dbyings las phyi rol du gyur pa'i mu stegs pa rnams 'di ni bdag gi srog dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang zhes sna tshogs par so sor snang ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du zab cing gting dpag par dka' ba'i chos kyi dbyings las phyi rol du gyur pa'i mu stegs pa rnams 'di ni bdag gi srog dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang zhes sna tshogs par so sor snang ste /
translated: Likewise, the tīrthikas, who are outside the profound and hard-to-comprehend realm of reality, say, “This is my life-force, person, and individual,” and so on, appearing in various ways.

original: ci de kho na nyid la 'dir du ma'i rnam pa yod pa nyid dam zhes pa la med par bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci de kho na nyid la 'dir du ma'i rnam pa yod pa nyid dam zhes pa la med par bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Here, is there a multiplicity of aspects in reality? To teach that it does not exist, it is said:

original: gcig ces pa ste 'dir gang zhig mngon par 'dod pa'i de kho na nyid de ni gcig gi tshul du bzung ba nyid do //
analyzed: gcig ces pa ste 'dir gang zhig mngon par 'dod pa'i de kho na nyid de ni gcig gi tshul du bzung ba nyid do //
translated: “One” means that the reality that is asserted here is apprehended as a single mode.

original: gcig pa nyid ci'i phyir zhes pa la gsungs pa /
analyzed: gcig pa nyid ci'i phyir zhes pa la gsungs pa /
translated: Why is it one? It is said:

original: du ma nyid du zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: du ma nyid du zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Not a multiplicity” and so on.

original: du ma nyid ces pa ni sems pa la sogs pa de rnams so //
analyzed: du ma nyid ces pa ni sems pa la sogs pa de rnams so //
translated: “Multiplicity” refers to those such as intention.

original: gang zhig du ma nyid sna tshogs kyi rnam par yod pa ni mi skye ste /
analyzed: gang zhig du ma nyid sna tshogs kyi rnam par yod pa ni mi skye ste /
translated: That which exists as a multiplicity of various aspects does not arise,

original: reg pas mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: reg pas mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not cognized by contact.

original: gang gi phyir du mar 'gyur ba ni gcig las 'grub po //
analyzed: gang gi phyir du mar 'gyur ba ni gcig las 'grub po //
translated: For the sake of what is manifold, which is established from one.

original: ji ltar chu bo rnams su du mar 'grub pa ni rgya mtsho las 'grub po //
analyzed: ji ltar chu bo rnams su du mar 'grub pa ni rgya mtsho las 'grub po //
translated: Just as the establishment of the manifold in rivers is established from the ocean.

original: gal te du ma'i rgyus sna tshogs kyi rnam par rtogs na de lta na rgya mtshor zhugs pa'i chu bo rnams sna tshogs su so sor snang bar rigs so //
analyzed: gal te du ma'i rgyus sna tshogs kyi rnam par rtogs na de lta na rgya mtshor zhugs pa'i chu bo rnams sna tshogs su so sor snang bar rigs so //
translated: If the manifold cause is the various conceptualizations, then it is reasonable that the rivers that enter the ocean appear separately as various.

original: de'i phyir du ma nyid du mi 'byung zhes pa'i rigs pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir du ma nyid du mi 'byung zhes pa'i rigs pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the reasoning that says “the manifold does not arise from the manifold” is stated.

original: de la rang bzhin gyis yod pa'i chu bo rnams 'dir dngos po dang dngos po med pa la @69b sogs pa'i gcig pa nyid du brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: de la rang bzhin gyis yod pa'i chu bo rnams 'dir dngos po dang dngos po med pa la @69b sogs pa'i gcig pa nyid du brjod par mi nus te /
translated: Here, the rivers that exist by way of their own nature cannot be said to be the same as things and nonthings, and so on.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: ji srid chu ru chu zhugs pa //
analyzed: ji srid chu ru chu zhugs pa //
translated: As long as the water enters the water,

original: de nyid ro mnyam gyur pa yin //
analyzed: de nyid ro mnyam gyur pa yin //
translated: it becomes of the same taste.

original: sems la skyon yon rnam pa dag / rmongs pa gnyen po'i phyogs 'chad med //
analyzed: sems la skyon yon rnam pa dag / rmongs pa gnyen po'i phyogs 'chad med //
translated: In the mind, the faults and good qualities are not explained as the antidote of delusion.

original: ces pa'o // 'di rnams gsungs par gyur pa /
analyzed: ces pa'o // 'di rnams gsungs par gyur pa /
translated: These are stated.

original: sems pa dang bdag la sogs pa yod par rigs pas mi rtogs so //
analyzed: sems pa dang bdag la sogs pa yod par rigs pas mi rtogs so //
translated: The mind, the self, and so on are not understood to exist by reasoning.

original: gal te rigs pa yod par gyur kyang /
analyzed: gal te rigs pa yod par gyur kyang /
translated: Even if there were reasoning,

original: gang zhig sems pa la sogs pa'i chos thams cad bdag med par zhugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zhig sems pa la sogs pa'i chos thams cad bdag med par zhugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: one would not enter into the selflessness of all phenomena such as the mind.

original: de lta bas na de rnams sna tshogs su so sor snang bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bas na de rnams sna tshogs su so sor snang bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, they would not appear individually as various.

original: ji ltar rgya mtshor zhugs pa'i chu bo rnams sna tshogs kyi gzugs su so sor snang ba med pa bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar rgya mtshor zhugs pa'i chu bo rnams sna tshogs kyi gzugs su so sor snang ba med pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as the rivers entering the ocean do not appear individually in various forms,

original: sna tshogs ma grub pas de kho na nyid gcig pa'i rnam pa nyid du go bar bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs ma grub pas de kho na nyid gcig pa'i rnam pa nyid du go bar bya zhes pa'o //
translated: the non-establishment of various [forms] should be understood as the aspect of the oneness of reality.

original: de kho na nyid gcig pa de ltar de kho na nyid gsum gang las thob par bya zhes pa la gsungs pa /
analyzed: de kho na nyid gcig pa de ltar de kho na nyid gsum gang las thob par bya zhes pa la gsungs pa /
translated: In that way, from where is that oneness of reality obtained? It is said:

original: bla ma'i zhal las shes zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bla ma'i zhal las shes zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: From the guru's mouth.

original: rgyud dang sngags rnams ston pa ni bla ma'o //
analyzed: rgyud dang sngags rnams ston pa ni bla ma'o //
translated: The guru is the one who teaches the tantras and mantras.

original: de'i zhal ni nye bar bstan pas so //
analyzed: de'i zhal ni nye bar bstan pas so //
translated: From the mouth of that [guru], through direct instruction,

original: thob pa ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: thob pa ni shes pa'o //
translated: one obtains knowledge.

original: de la man ngag bstan pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de la man ngag bstan pa gsungs pa /
translated: The teaching of the intimate instructions is stated:

original: nang du zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nang du zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The inner space, etc.

original: rtsa rnams lus la ji lta ba'i gzugs kyis gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa rnams lus la ji lta ba'i gzugs kyis gnas pa'o //
translated: The channels are located in the body in the form of the body.

original: gang du gnas zhes pa la gsungs pa /🔽bha ga'i dbus su nam mkha' gang //
analyzed: gang du gnas zhes pa la gsungs pa / bha ga'i dbus su nam mkha' gang //
translated: Where are they located? It is stated:

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The space in the middle of the bhaga, etc.

original: nam mkha' zhes pa ni padma'i lte bar rtsa'i khong stong gi gnas so //
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes pa ni padma'i lte bar rtsa'i khong stong gi gnas so //
translated: Space is the location of the empty interior of the channel in the center of the lotus.

original: de'i khyad par ji lta bu dang ldan zhes pa la gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i khyad par ji lta bu dang ldan zhes pa la gsungs pa /
translated: What are the characteristics of that? It is stated:

original: nam mkha' lnga zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' lnga zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The five spaces, etc.

original: nam mkha' lnga zhes pa ni khrag dang / dri chu dang / dri chen dang / khu ba 'dzag pa'i bzur bas rtsa lnga'i khong stong ni nam mkha'i phyogs so //
analyzed: nam mkha' lnga zhes pa ni khrag dang / dri chu dang / dri chen dang / khu ba 'dzag pa'i bzur bas rtsa lnga'i khong stong ni nam mkha'i phyogs so //
translated: The five spaces are the empty interiors of the five channels that are blocked by the dripping of blood, urine, feces, semen, and regenerative fluid.

original: bshad lugs gzhan yang chu dang mi dang sa dang rlung ste /
analyzed: bshad lugs gzhan yang chu dang mi dang sa dang rlung ste /
translated: Another system of explanation is water, earth, fire, and air.

original: grang ba dang / dro ba dang / gnyis ka dang / dri'i mtshan gyis nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor gyi nang du 'dus pas nam mkha' lnga yis brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: grang ba dang / dro ba dang / gnyis ka dang / dri'i mtshan gyis nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor gyi nang du 'dus pas nam mkha' lnga yis brgyan pa'o //
translated: It is adorned with the five spaces, since the space maṇḍala in the middle is filled with the signs of the cold, hot, and both, and with smell.

original: nam mkha' gcig pus ni ma yin te padmas kyang brgyan zhes pa la gsungs pa /
analyzed: nam mkha' gcig pus ni ma yin te padmas kyang brgyan zhes pa la gsungs pa /
translated: It is not adorned with space alone, but also with a lotus.

original: lte ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lte ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: [The Bhagavān] declares that:🔽In the middle of the navel,

original: lte ba'i dbus su ze 'bru'i ge sar ni de'i 'gram nas skyes pa ste de yis ldan pa'o //
analyzed: lte ba'i dbus su ze 'bru'i ge sar ni de'i 'gram nas skyes pa ste de yis ldan pa'o //
translated: in the middle of the navel, the stamen is born from its side, and it is endowed with that.

original: 'dab ma brgyad ni 'dab ma brgyad pa'i padma @70a * //
analyzed: 'dab ma brgyad ni 'dab ma brgyad pa'i padma @70a * //
translated: The lotus is an eight-petaled lotus,

original: ste des brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: ste des brgyan pa'o //
translated: and it is adorned with that.

original: de'i zhes pa ni padma'i nam mkhar ro //
analyzed: de'i zhes pa ni padma'i nam mkhar ro //
translated: In that, in the space of the lotus,

original: gang zhig rdo rje'i nor bu dang padma'i lte ba dag sbyar zhing gzir ba de'i dbus su'o //
analyzed: gang zhig rdo rje'i nor bu dang padma'i lte ba dag sbyar zhing gzir ba de'i dbus su'o //
translated: in the middle of that, where the vajra jewel and the lotus stamen are joined and pressed,

original: rdo rje can zhes pa ni 'dod chags chen po'i bdag nyid kyi rdo rje bdud rtsi'i snying po'o //
analyzed: rdo rje can zhes pa ni 'dod chags chen po'i bdag nyid kyi rdo rje bdud rtsi'i snying po'o //
translated: the vajra possessor, the essence of vajra amṛta, whose nature is great passion,

original: de ji lta bu'i rnam par gnas zhes pa la khu pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ji lta bu'i rnam par gnas zhes pa la khu pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: resides in what way?

original: khu bas phye ba nyid kyis khu ba ste bdud rtsi gzhom du med par yang dag par rig pa'i tshul 'dis na bdud rtsis gzugs so //
analyzed: khu bas phye ba nyid kyis khu ba ste bdud rtsi gzhom du med par yang dag par rig pa'i tshul 'dis na bdud rtsis gzugs so //
translated: By the division of the juice, it is the juice, the nectar, which is also known as the indestructible. By this method of knowing, it is the form of nectar.

original: gzhan yang de'i bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang de'i bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Moreover, in order to specify it, he says:

original: cha dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: cha dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: part and so on.

original: cha zhes pa ni aa yig la sogs pa ma mo rnams so //
analyzed: cha zhes pa ni aa yig la sogs pa ma mo rnams so //
translated: Part refers to the mātṛkā vowels beginning with a.

original: cha min ni ka yig la sogs pa'i gsal byed de /
analyzed: cha min ni ka yig la sogs pa'i gsal byed de /
translated: Not part refers to the consonants beginning with ka.

original: de gnyis las rnam par grol ba ni bral ba'o //
analyzed: de gnyis las rnam par grol ba ni bral ba'o //
translated: Freed from both means free from both.

original: thig le zhes pa ni aam yig go //
analyzed: thig le zhes pa ni aam yig go //
translated: Drop refers to the syllable aṃ.

original: thig le nyid ring por brjod pa ni n'a da'o //
analyzed: thig le nyid ring por brjod pa ni n'a da'o //
translated: Drop itself is said to be long refers to nāda.

original: de gnyi ga spangs pa ni dbyangs med pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de gnyi ga spangs pa ni dbyangs med pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Abandoning both means without vowel.

original: gnas der ci zhig byed ces pa la gsungs pa /
analyzed: gnas der ci zhig byed ces pa la gsungs pa /
translated: What is done in that place? He says:

original: 'dzag ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzag ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: dripping and so on.

original: ci zhig 'dzag ces pa la bdud rtsi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ci zhig 'dzag ces pa la bdud rtsi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: What drips? He says: nectar and so on.

original: bdud rtsi khu ba'i gzugs ni zhu ba'i tshul zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bdud rtsi khu ba'i gzugs ni zhu ba'i tshul zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The form of the juice of nectar is the method of melting.

original: 'dod chags chen po'i tshul nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'dod chags chen po'i tshul nyid kyis so //
translated: By the method of great passion.

original: de'i man ngag ni 'di yin te padma'i nor bu'i dbus su mchog tu bde ba'i dga' ba rang rig pa'i rang bzhin dbyangs dang bral ba'i ha yig ni rdo rje bdud rtsi'o //
analyzed: de'i man ngag ni 'di yin te padma'i nor bu'i dbus su mchog tu bde ba'i dga' ba rang rig pa'i rang bzhin dbyangs dang bral ba'i ha yig ni rdo rje bdud rtsi'o //
translated: The esoteric instruction is this: In the middle of the lotus gem, the syllable ha, which is the nature of the supreme bliss of the joy of self-awareness, devoid of vowels, is vajra-amṛta.

original: snying po de kho na nyid ces dgongs so //
analyzed: snying po de kho na nyid ces dgongs so //
translated: The essence is reality itself, it is thought.

original: 'khrig pa'i chos kyi rang dag par sbyor bas de dang 'dra bar 'dod chags chen po'i tshul 'khrig pa'i chos kyi gnas skabs so //
analyzed: 'khrig pa'i chos kyi rang dag par sbyor bas de dang 'dra bar 'dod chags chen po'i tshul 'khrig pa'i chos kyi gnas skabs so //
translated: By the union of the purity of the dharma of copulation, in that way, the method of great passion is the occasion of the dharma of copulation.🔽What is the method of that?

original: de'i tshul ji lta bu zhes pa la lus kyi rab tu sbyor bas rgyas par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i tshul ji lta bu zhes pa la lus kyi rab tu sbyor bas rgyas par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In order to explain the practice of the body, it is said:

original: gzhi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The basis, etc.

original: gzhi zhes pa ni srog chags kyi lus la gnas pa rnams kyi gzhi'o //
analyzed: gzhi zhes pa ni srog chags kyi lus la gnas pa rnams kyi gzhi'o //
translated: The basis is the basis of those abiding in the body of a living being.🔽Whose basis?

original: gang rnams kyi gzhi zhes pa la kun gyi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang rnams kyi gzhi zhes pa la kun gyi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is said: of all, etc.

original: khu ba dang / rus pa dang / rkang dang / sha dang / khrag la sogs pa'i ro bcud rnams so //
analyzed: khu ba dang / rus pa dang / rkang dang / sha dang / khrag la sogs pa'i ro bcud rnams so //
translated: the essence of the taste of semen, bones, marrow, flesh, blood, and so forth.

original: thams cad du rlung gi rnam pa gzhom du med pa'i rnam par shes pa ste snying gar gnas zhes gsungs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad du rlung gi rnam pa gzhom du med pa'i rnam par shes pa ste snying gar gnas zhes gsungs par gyur pa'o //
translated: Everywhere, the aspect of wind is the consciousness that is not to be destroyed, which is located in the heart.

original: de ltar gyur pa de'i 'gro ba'i spyod pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa de'i 'gro ba'i spyod pa gsungs pa /
translated: Having become that, the conduct of his movement is stated:

original: 'og dang zhes pa la sogs @70b pa'o ;
analyzed: 'og dang zhes pa la sogs @70b pa'o ;
translated: Below and above, the yogi should🔽contemplate the movement of the wind.

original: ;'og ces pa ni snying ga'i 'og ste lte ba dang bha ga'o //
analyzed: ;'og ces pa ni snying ga'i 'og ste lte ba dang bha ga'o //
translated: “Below” is below the heart, the navel, and the bhaga.

original: steng zhes pa ni sna'i rtse mo nas ji srid nam mkha'i bar du ste /
analyzed: steng zhes pa ni sna'i rtse mo nas ji srid nam mkha'i bar du ste /
translated: “Above” is from the tip of the nose up to the sky.

original: 'di rnams kyi mthar thug par rlung gi rnam pas khyab par byed ces pas so //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi mthar thug par rlung gi rnam pas khyab par byed ces pas so //
translated: These are pervaded by the aspect of wind, which is the limit of these.

original: yang na 'og ces pa ni rkang pa'i mthil lo //
analyzed: yang na 'og ces pa ni rkang pa'i mthil lo //
translated: Or, “below” is the soles of the feet.

original: steng zhes pa ni spyi gtsug gi mtshams kyi mthar thug pa'i lus mtha' dag la myos byed kyi rnam pas khyab cing gnas zhes pa ni khyab par byed pas so //
analyzed: steng zhes pa ni spyi gtsug gi mtshams kyi mthar thug pa'i lus mtha' dag la myos byed kyi rnam pas khyab cing gnas zhes pa ni khyab par byed pas so //
translated: “Above” is the crown of the head. The entire body is pervaded by the aspect of the intoxicating one, which is the limit of these. “Abiding” is pervaded by the pervader.

original: gang du gsungs pa'i lus 'di dag la ji lta ba bzhin rol te de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang du gsungs pa'i lus 'di dag la ji lta ba bzhin rol te de'i phyir /
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: 'dis ni rol pa rgyas par bshad pa nye bar bstan zhes pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni rol pa rgyas par bshad pa nye bar bstan zhes pa lhag ma'o //
translated: The rest is self-evident.

original: 'di'i rnam pa gcig pus khyab pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i rnam pa gcig pus khyab pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that he is pervaded by this one form alone.

original: bya ba gang gis khyab byed ces pa la gsungs pa /🔽blta dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba gang gis khyab byed ces pa la gsungs pa / blta dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: He is pervaded by that which is to be pervaded by the action by which he pervades.🔽This is what is being said.🔽By the action of seeing, etc.

original: blta ba la sogs pa'i bya ba rnams ni khyab bya ste /
analyzed: blta ba la sogs pa'i bya ba rnams ni khyab bya ste /
translated: The action of seeing, etc. is that which is to be pervaded.

original: gzhan ni de nyid rnam par gnas zhes pa 'dir 'brel to //🔽blta dang zhes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la brten nas lha'i spyod yul bsgribs pa la sogs pa'i dngos po'i bye brag rnams kyang yang dag par shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni de nyid rnam par gnas zhes pa 'dir 'brel to // blta dang zhes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la brten nas lha'i spyod yul bsgribs pa la sogs pa'i dngos po'i bye brag rnams kyang yang dag par shes pa'o //
translated: The rest is connected to this:🔽By the action of seeing, etc.🔽By the action of seeing, etc. means that by means of the eye consciousness, one also correctly knows the various specific things that are the domain of the gods, such as the obscured, etc.

original: de ltar rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la brten nas lha'i spyod yul bsgribs pa la sogs pa'i dngos po yongs su gcod pas sgra nyan par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la brten nas lha'i spyod yul bsgribs pa la sogs pa'i dngos po yongs su gcod pas sgra nyan par byed do //
translated: In the same way, by means of the ear consciousness, one hears sounds by means of the discernment of things that are the domain of the gods, such as the obscured, etc.

original: snom pa ni sna'i rnam par shes pa la brten nas dri bzang po la sogs pa'i dri rnams snom par byed do //
analyzed: snom pa ni sna'i rnam par shes pa la brten nas dri bzang po la sogs pa'i dri rnams snom par byed do //
translated: Smelling is the smelling of good smells and so forth based on the nose consciousness.

original: lce'i rnam par shes pa la brten nas ro zhim pa la sogs pa'i rdzas rnams myong bar byed do //
analyzed: lce'i rnam par shes pa la brten nas ro zhim pa la sogs pa'i rdzas rnams myong bar byed do //
translated: Tasting is the tasting of substances with good tastes and so forth based on the tongue consciousness.

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa la brten nas bde ba'i reg pa dang phreng ba la sogs pa'i rgyan rnams la reg pa'i bag chags kyis reg par byed do //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa la brten nas bde ba'i reg pa dang phreng ba la sogs pa'i rgyan rnams la reg pa'i bag chags kyis reg par byed do //
translated: Touching is the touching of pleasant touches and so forth based on the body consciousness.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa la brten nas tshig rab tu rgyas pa ste legs par sbyar ba la sogs pa'i mdzes pa rnams so //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa la brten nas tshig rab tu rgyas pa ste legs par sbyar ba la sogs pa'i mdzes pa rnams so //
translated: Mind is the mind that is based on the mental consciousness and is the beauty of the extensive words, the well-formed words, and so forth.

original: ri mo zhes pa ni ri mo mkhan la brten nas ri mo'i las shes pa'o //
analyzed: ri mo zhes pa ni ri mo mkhan la brten nas ri mo'i las shes pa'o //
translated: Painting is the knowledge of painting based on the painter.

original: dri za la brten nas dri za'i cho ga shes pa'o //
analyzed: dri za la brten nas dri za'i cho ga shes pa'o //
translated: Gandharva is the knowledge of the ritual of the gandharva.

original: aa ni kun gyi don te /
analyzed: aa ni kun gyi don te /
translated: A is the meaning of all.

original: ster ba ni kun du ster bar byed cing yang nas yang du ster ba'o //
analyzed: ster ba ni kun du ster bar byed cing yang nas yang du ster ba'o //
translated: Giving is giving completely and giving again and again.

original: 'dzin pa zhes pa ni so sor 'dzin cing zhen pa'i srid pa'i rnam par shes pa la brten nas len par byed do //
analyzed: 'dzin pa zhes pa ni so sor 'dzin cing zhen pa'i srid pa'i rnam par shes pa la brten nas len par byed do //
translated: “Grasping” is the appropriation based on the consciousness of existence, which is the individual grasping and clinging.

original: rol rtsed ces pa ni nor la sogs pa la brten nas cho lo'i gtam la sogs pas longs spyod pa'o //🔽rgyug pa zhes @71a * //
analyzed: rol rtsed ces pa ni nor la sogs pa la brten nas cho lo'i gtam la sogs pas longs spyod pa'o // rgyug pa zhes @71a * //
translated: “Play” is the enjoyment based on wealth, etc., through the talk of games, etc.

original: pa ni 'gro ba la brten nas mgyogs par rgyug pa'o //
analyzed: pa ni 'gro ba la brten nas mgyogs par rgyug pa'o //
translated: “Running” is the quick running based on going.

original: ngal zhing chad pas dbugs 'byin pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽gnyid kyi rang bzhin gyis non pas nyal bar byed do //
analyzed: ngal zhing chad pas dbugs 'byin pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro // gnyid kyi rang bzhin gyis non pas nyal bar byed do //
translated: “Exhaustion” is the arising of the breath due to fatigue.🔽“Sleeping” is the lying down due to being overcome by the nature of sleep.

original: gnyid dang bral bas rab tu sad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyid dang bral bas rab tu sad par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Awakening” is the arising from sleep.

original: de nyid ces pa ni de kho na nyid kyi rgyal po'o ;
analyzed: de nyid ces pa ni de kho na nyid kyi rgyal po'o ;
translated: “That itself” is the king of reality.

original: ; gnyid mthug pa ni dngos po mtha' dag gi bag chags las rmi lam du yang glang po dang / shing rta dang / rta la sogs pa mngon sum lta bur mthong ba'o //
analyzed: ; gnyid mthug pa ni dngos po mtha' dag gi bag chags las rmi lam du yang glang po dang / shing rta dang / rta la sogs pa mngon sum lta bur mthong ba'o //
translated: “Deep sleep” is the seeing of elephants, chariots, horses, etc., in dreams as if in actuality, from the latent impressions of all things.

original: dgod pa'i dngos po la brten nas dgod par byed do //
analyzed: dgod pa'i dngos po la brten nas dgod par byed do //
translated: “Laughing” is the laughing based on the things that cause laughter.

original: mya ngan gyi rang bzhin la brten nas ngu bar byed do //🔽spro ba'i rang bzhin gyis gar byed do //
analyzed: mya ngan gyi rang bzhin la brten nas ngu bar byed do // spro ba'i rang bzhin gyis gar byed do //
translated: One weeps on account of the nature of sorrow.🔽One dances on account of the nature of joy.

original: gar mkhan la brten nas so //
analyzed: gar mkhan la brten nas so //
translated: One dances on account of the nature of joy.

original: ltad mo la brten nas rdza rnga dang rnga rings dang / rnga bo che la sogs pa'i rol mo byed do //
analyzed: ltad mo la brten nas rdza rnga dang rnga rings dang / rnga bo che la sogs pa'i rol mo byed do //
translated: One plays musical instruments such as the drum, the tabor, and the flute on account of the nature of the spectacle.🔽One speaks various languages such as Karnāṭa on account of the nature of the people of the country.

original: yul gyi mi la sogs pa'i mi la brten nas karna ta la sogs pa'i sna tshogs pa'i gtam smra bar byed do //
analyzed: yul gyi mi la sogs pa'i mi la brten nas karna ta la sogs pa'i sna tshogs pa'i gtam smra bar byed do //
translated: One is possessed by a ghost on account of the nature of the spell.🔽One is a madman on account of the nature of the medicine.🔽One is a drunkard on account of the nature of the liquor.🔽One is a lunatic on account of the nature of the liquor.

original: sman gyi sbyor bas rlung can du byed pa dang / chang gis myos pa ni smyon pa ste /🔽tha mal pa las gzhan du smra ba'o //
analyzed: sman gyi sbyor bas rlung can du byed pa dang / chang gis myos pa ni smyon pa ste / tha mal pa las gzhan du smra ba'o //
translated: One is a drunkard on account of the nature of the liquor.🔽One is a lunatic on account of the nature of the liquor.🔽One is a drunkard on account of the nature of the liquor.🔽One is a lunatic on account of the nature of the liquor.🔽One is a drunkard on account of the nature of the liquor.🔽One is a lunatic on account of the nature of the liquor.🔽One is a drunkard on account of the nature of the liquor.🔽One is a lunatic on account of the nature of the liquor.🔽One is a drunkard on account of the nature of the liquor.🔽One is a lunatic on account of the nature of the liquor.🔽One is a drunkard on account of the nature of the liquor.🔽One is a lunatic on account of the nature of the liquor.🔽One is a drunkard on account of the nature of the liquor.🔽One is a lunatic on account of the nature of the liquor.🔽One is a drunkard on account of the nature of the liquor.🔽One is a lunatic on account of the nature of the liquor.🔽One is a drunkard on account of the nature of the liquor.🔽One is a lunatic on account of the nature of the liquor.

original: chang la sogs pa'i btung bas bzhi zhing myos pa ni bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa mi dpyod pa ste /
analyzed: chang la sogs pa'i btung bas bzhi zhing myos pa ni bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa mi dpyod pa ste /
translated: One is a drunkard on account of the nature of the liquor.🔽One is a lunatic on account of the nature of the liquor.

original: chang gis 'di thams cad nyid ces dgongs so //🔽gti mug ni gti mug gi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: chang gis 'di thams cad nyid ces dgongs so // gti mug ni gti mug gi bdag nyid can no //
translated: One is a drunkard on account of the nature of the liquor.🔽One is a lunatic on account of the nature of the liquor.🔽One is a drunkard on account of the nature of the liquor.🔽One is a lunatic on account of the nature of the liquor.

original: 'dod chags zhes pa ni chags pa'i 'dod chags dang khro ba'i 'dod chags so //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhes pa ni chags pa'i 'dod chags dang khro ba'i 'dod chags so //
translated: One is a drunkard on account of the nature of the liquor.🔽One is a lunatic on account of

original: chags pa'i rang bzhin ni spro ba las 'dod chags te sgeg pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: chags pa'i rang bzhin ni spro ba las 'dod chags te sgeg pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The nature of passion is desire, which is the nature of charm.

original: khro bo'i rang bzhin gyi sbyor ba las ni rang gi dngos po'o //
analyzed: khro bo'i rang bzhin gyi sbyor ba las ni rang gi dngos po'o //
translated: The nature of anger is the union of one’s own nature with the union of anger.

original: tsam gyi gzugs zhes pa ni du ma'i gzugs kyi rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: tsam gyi gzugs zhes pa ni du ma'i gzugs kyi rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The word “mere” in “mere form” means the nature of multiple forms.

original: gzugs yang dag par brje ba'i thob pa las bud med kyi dngos po dang ldan na bud med du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs yang dag par brje ba'i thob pa las bud med kyi dngos po dang ldan na bud med du 'gyur ro //
translated: From the attainment of the transformation of form, one becomes a woman if endowed with the state of a woman.

original: skyes pa'i dbang po thob na skyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes pa'i dbang po thob na skyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one attains the male organ, one becomes a man.

original: gnyis ka'i mtshan ma med na ma ning ngo //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i mtshan ma med na ma ning ngo //
translated: If one has neither sex organ, one becomes a eunuch.

original: sna tshogs gzugs zhes pa ni lha dang lha ma yin la sogs pa'i bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba la mnyam par brten pa'i sbyor ba las so //
analyzed: sna tshogs gzugs zhes pa ni lha dang lha ma yin la sogs pa'i bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba la mnyam par brten pa'i sbyor ba las so //
translated: “Various forms” means from the union of the latent tendencies of gods, demigods, and so on, based on the support of the mind.

original: lha la sogs pa'i rkang gnyis pa dang / rkang bzhi pa dang / rkang mangs dang / rkang med la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: lha la sogs pa'i rkang gnyis pa dang / rkang bzhi pa dang / rkang mangs dang / rkang med la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The various aspects are the two-legged, four-legged, many-legged, and legless gods and so on.

original: sna tshogs bdag nyid ces pa ni sna tshogs pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: sna tshogs bdag nyid ces pa ni sna tshogs pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: The “nature of various things” is by the nature of various things.

original: @71b sna tshogs gzugs kyi nor bu 'dis dpes so sor rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: @71b sna tshogs gzugs kyi nor bu 'dis dpes so sor rtogs par bya ste /
translated: This should be understood by the example of a jewel of various forms.

original: ji ltar nor bu gcig nyid la 'bru dang me tog la sogs pa la nye bar brten nas kha dog sna tshogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar nor bu gcig nyid la 'bru dang me tog la sogs pa la nye bar brten nas kha dog sna tshogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as a single jewel, in dependence on grains, flowers, etc., produces various colors,

original: de bzhin du de kho na nyid kyang 'gro ba mtha' dag gi bag chags la nye bar brten nas sna tshogs pa'i gzugs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du de kho na nyid kyang 'gro ba mtha' dag gi bag chags la nye bar brten nas sna tshogs pa'i gzugs su 'gyur ro //
translated: so reality also, in dependence on the habitual tendencies of the entire world, becomes of various forms.

original: khyab bya khyab byed dngos po yis //
analyzed: khyab bya khyab byed dngos po yis //
translated: By the nature of the pervaded and the pervader.

original: zhes pa 'dis ni lus la sogs pa'i dngos po ni khyab bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa 'dis ni lus la sogs pa'i dngos po ni khyab bya'o //
translated: Here, the things of the body, etc., are the pervaded.

original: lta bar byed pa dang nyon mongs pa'i bya ba rnams ni khyab par byed pa ste /
analyzed: lta bar byed pa dang nyon mongs pa'i bya ba rnams ni khyab par byed pa ste /
translated: The activities of seeing and the afflictions are the pervader.

original: de dag gi dngos po ni rang bzhin te khyab bya dang khyab byed kyi dngos po'o //
analyzed: de dag gi dngos po ni rang bzhin te khyab bya dang khyab byed kyi dngos po'o //
translated: Their nature is the essence of the pervaded and the pervader.

original: de nas mchog ni de nyid do //
analyzed: de nas mchog ni de nyid do //
translated: Then, the supreme is that reality.

original: rnam par shes pa gzhom du med pa'i rnam pa ste de lta bur 'gyur ba'i 'gro ba'i grong du rnam par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gzhom du med pa'i rnam pa ste de lta bur 'gyur ba'i 'gro ba'i grong du rnam par gnas pa'o //
translated: The form of the invincible consciousness, thus situated in the city of the world.

original: gang du brjod pa'i //
analyzed: gang du brjod pa'i //
translated: Where is it said?

original: ji ltar dbang po gnyis ni sbyong //
analyzed: ji ltar dbang po gnyis ni sbyong //
translated: How is the union of the two organs?

original: ces pa dang / de ni 'di yis mthong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ces pa dang / de ni 'di yis mthong bar 'gyur //
translated: And, “That is seen by this.”

original: zhes pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: zhes pa nas brtsams te /
translated: Beginning from here,

original: rnam par gnas zhes pa'i mthar thug pa'i gzhung gis dbang po gnyis kyi nye bar longs spyod pa bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par gnas zhes pa'i mthar thug pa'i gzhung gis dbang po gnyis kyi nye bar longs spyod pa bstan to //
translated: up to the end of the passage, “situated,” the enjoyment of the two organs is taught.

original: ji srid de kho na nyid la spyod pa yod dam zhes pa la /
analyzed: ji srid de kho na nyid la spyod pa yod dam zhes pa la /
translated: As long as there is the practice of reality,

original: med par bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: med par bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: in order to teach the nonexistence of that, he says,

original: 'di la zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Here,” and so on.

original: 'di zhes pa ni de ma thag tu gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes pa ni de ma thag tu gsungs pa'o //
translated: “Here” is the immediately preceding [statement].

original: de nyid ces pa ni srog gi bdag gi bdag nyid kyi ha yig go //
analyzed: de nyid ces pa ni srog gi bdag gi bdag nyid kyi ha yig go //
translated: “That itself” is the letter ha, the nature of the self of life.

original: bdag ma zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ma zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
translated: “Selfless” is the negation.

original: bzlas pa med ces pa ni stong phrag la sogs pa'i grangs su bcad pa'i sngon gyi bsnyen pa'o //
analyzed: bzlas pa med ces pa ni stong phrag la sogs pa'i grangs su bcad pa'i sngon gyi bsnyen pa'o //
translated: “No repetition” is the prior recitation, which is counted in thousands and so on.

original: 'dzin pa zhes pa ni srog dang rtsol ba la sogs pa'i bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa zhes pa ni srog dang rtsol ba la sogs pa'i bsgom pa'o //
translated: Grasping is the meditation on prāṇa and āyāma, etc.

original: phreng ba'i grangs gzung ba'i phyir 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: phreng ba'i grangs gzung ba'i phyir 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Grasping is for the purpose of counting the rosary.

original: bya ba ni nas dang lo ma dang so ba la sogs pa za bas snum bag med pa'i zas za pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba ni nas dang lo ma dang so ba la sogs pa za bas snum bag med pa'i zas za pa'o //
translated: Action is the eating of food that is not oily, such as barley, leaves, and vegetables, etc.

original: smyung ba ni zas mi za ba'i'o //
analyzed: smyung ba ni zas mi za ba'i'o //
translated: Fasting is not eating food.

original: 'dod pa lnga la nye bar longs spyod pa nyid kyis sa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa lnga la nye bar longs spyod pa nyid kyis sa'o //
translated: Desire is the enjoyment of the five desires.

original: 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i nye bar longs spyod pa thams cad ni med cing 'dod pa thams cad la nye bar longs spyod pa la 'jug pa ni yod par dgongs so //
analyzed: 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i nye bar longs spyod pa thams cad ni med cing 'dod pa thams cad la nye bar longs spyod pa la 'jug pa ni yod par dgongs so //
translated: Grasping, etc., are all enjoyments, and the enjoyment of all desires is considered to be existent.

original: de nas thams cad la nye bar longs spyod pa nyid kyis 'grub ces bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa //
analyzed: de nas thams cad la nye bar longs spyod pa nyid kyis 'grub ces bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa //
translated: Then, in order to teach that accomplishment is by the enjoyment of everything, he says:

original: mchod par bya zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mchod par bya zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Worship, etc.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams 'joms pas ni bha ga'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams 'joms pas ni bha ga'o //
translated: The bhaga is because it conquers the afflictions.

original: 'dod par bya ba nyid kyis padma'o //
analyzed: 'dod par bya ba nyid kyis padma'o //
translated: The lotus is because it is desirable.

original: de yang dag par rig pa ni mchod @72a * //
analyzed: de yang dag par rig pa ni mchod @72a * //
translated: That knowledge is worship.

original: pa'am me tog la sogs pa'i mchod pa'i mchod pa ste mchod cing dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: pa'am me tog la sogs pa'i mchod pa'i mchod pa ste mchod cing dbul bar bya'o //
translated: One should worship, i.e., make offerings, with the offering of flowers, etc.

original: de'i de ma thag tu bdud rtsi bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i de ma thag tu bdud rtsi bza' bar bya'o //
translated: Immediately after that, one should eat the nectar.🔽What is the result of that?

original: des cir 'gyur zhes pa la gsungs pa /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhes pa la gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: 'dis ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “By this, etc.”

original: 'dis ni zhes pa ni mchod pa'i rnam pa 'dis mchod pas so //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes pa ni mchod pa'i rnam pa 'dis mchod pas so //
translated: “By this” means by this form of worship.

original: 'grub pa ni 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'grub pa ni 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: “One will attain” means one will obtain the result.

original: de nyid ces pa ni snying po mchog tu khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces pa ni snying po mchog tu khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
translated: “That itself” means the essence, which is especially exalted.

original: rdo rje bdud rtsi bde ba che //
analyzed: rdo rje bdud rtsi bde ba che //
translated: “Vajra-amṛta-mahāsukha”

original: zhes pa ni bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin no //
translated: means the nature of great bliss.

original: padma gcig pu kho na mchod par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: padma gcig pu kho na mchod par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not only the single lotus that is to be worshipped,

original: der gnas pa'i rtsa yang mchod par bya zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: der gnas pa'i rtsa yang mchod par bya zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: but also the channel that resides there is to be worshipped. In order to demonstrate that, it is said:

original: gang gis zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “By whom, etc.”

original: gang gis zhes pa ni sngon du snyoms par 'jug pa bstan pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes pa ni sngon du snyoms par 'jug pa bstan pa rnams kyis so //
translated: “By whom” means by those who have previously been taught to enter.

original: brtag pa gnyis pa las kyang rgyas par gsungs pa /
analyzed: brtag pa gnyis pa las kyang rgyas par gsungs pa /
translated: The second examination also explains this extensively.

original: rtsa ni padma'i lte bar gnas //
analyzed: rtsa ni padma'i lte bar gnas //
translated: The channel is located in the center of the lotus.

original: char 'bab par ni bshad pa ste //
analyzed: char 'bab par ni bshad pa ste //
translated: It is explained as the rain falling.

original: reg pa'i mchod pas mchod par bya //
analyzed: reg pa'i mchod pas mchod par bya //
translated: One should worship with the worship of touch.

original: zhes par 'brel to //
analyzed: zhes par 'brel to //
translated: This is the connection.

original: khyad par ji lta bu'i bdag nyid ces pa la sum cu rtsa gnyis zhes pa la sogs pa'o //🔽rgyun ma dang rtag ma dang / yul ma dang / phreng ma dang / lcug ma dang / dkyil 'khor ma dang / lnga ba ma dang / lte ba'i ra ba ma dang / ka ba ma dang / rnam rkang ma dang / 'jig ma dang /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu'i bdag nyid ces pa la sum cu rtsa gnyis zhes pa la sogs pa'o // rgyun ma dang rtag ma dang / yul ma dang / phreng ma dang / lcug ma dang / dkyil 'khor ma dang / lnga ba ma dang / lte ba'i ra ba ma dang / ka ba ma dang / rnam rkang ma dang / 'jig ma dang /
translated: What is the nature of the special? The thirty-two, etc.🔽The continuous, the constant, the non-object, the garland, the creeper, the mandala, the five-fold, the navel fence, the pillar, the leg, the destroyer,

original: g-yon ma dang / me'i sna ma dang / grub ma dang / nor bu'i kha dog dang / mgrin pa'i skud pa dang / shing rta'i gso ma dang / sbrul gyi lce ma dang / gdong na mo dang / gdong dug ma dang / phyogs ma dang /
analyzed: g-yon ma dang / me'i sna ma dang / grub ma dang / nor bu'i kha dog dang / mgrin pa'i skud pa dang / shing rta'i gso ma dang / sbrul gyi lce ma dang / gdong na mo dang / gdong dug ma dang / phyogs ma dang /
translated: the left, the fire-nose, the accomplished, the color of the jewel, the neck thread, the chariot-pole, the snake-tongue, the female face, the poisonous face, the direction,

original: mi 'phrogs ma dang / langs ma dang / bde langs ma dang / bzang mo dang / mig bzangs ma dang / 'dus ma dang / 'byung na ma dang / khrag 'bab ma dang / dri chu 'dzag ma dang / khu ba 'bab ma dang /
analyzed: mi 'phrogs ma dang / langs ma dang / bde langs ma dang / bzang mo dang / mig bzangs ma dang / 'dus ma dang / 'byung na ma dang / khrag 'bab ma dang / dri chu 'dzag ma dang / khu ba 'bab ma dang /
translated: the one called the “unconquerable,” the “arisen,” the “well-arisen,” the “good,” the “good-eyed,” the “assembled,” the “emerging,” the “blood-flowing,” the “urine-flowing,” the “semen-flowing,”

original: gtsang ma zhes pa ste sum cu rtsa gnyis so //
analyzed: gtsang ma zhes pa ste sum cu rtsa gnyis so //
translated: and the “pure.”

original: 'di rnams kyi nang na gtso bor myos byed 'bab pa ste /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi nang na gtso bor myos byed 'bab pa ste /
translated: Among these, the one called the “flowing of the intoxicating” is the chief.

original: rtsa thams cad la 'di nyid ni sgor gyur pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rtsa thams cad la 'di nyid ni sgor gyur pa nyid kyis so //
translated: It is the door of all the channels, because it is the door of all of them.

original: ji ltar chu bo rnams la rgya mtsho sgor gyur pa de bzhin du rtsa rnams la myos byed 'bab pa sgo nyid do //
analyzed: ji ltar chu bo rnams la rgya mtsho sgor gyur pa de bzhin du rtsa rnams la myos byed 'bab pa sgo nyid do //
translated: Just as the ocean is the door of the rivers, so the flowing of the intoxicating is the door of the channels.

original: sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi nang gcig pu las gtso bo yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi nang gcig pu las gtso bo yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that the chief one is only one among the thirty-two.

original: de las gzhan rtsa dgu yang gnas pas so //🔽de rnams kyi nang gi gtso bo de @72b yang mchod par bya zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de las gzhan rtsa dgu yang gnas pas so // de rnams kyi nang gi gtso bo de @72b yang mchod par bya zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: The other nine channels also exist there.🔽In order to teach that the chief one among them should be worshipped, he says:

original: de rnams las kyang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams las kyang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Among them, the one called the ‘flowing of the intoxicating’ is the chief.”

original: de rnams las zhes pa ni sum cu rtsa gnyis po rnams las so //
analyzed: de rnams las zhes pa ni sum cu rtsa gnyis po rnams las so //
translated: From among those, from those thirty-two means from among those thirty-two.

original: gzhan zhes pa ni gzhan rnams te /
analyzed: gzhan zhes pa ni gzhan rnams te /
translated: The others are the others.

original: sgrol ma dang / rnam sgrol dang / mkhur tshogs dang / nye ba'i mkhur tshos dang / sna ma dang / nye ba'i sna ma dang / 'gram pa'i phreng ma dang / bshad lam gnas ma dang / bya gdong ma zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sgrol ma dang / rnam sgrol dang / mkhur tshogs dang / nye ba'i mkhur tshos dang / sna ma dang / nye ba'i sna ma dang / 'gram pa'i phreng ma dang / bshad lam gnas ma dang / bya gdong ma zhes pa'o //
translated: They are Tārā, Viśvatārā, Pūrṇā, Upāpūrṇā, Mālikā, Upmālikā, Gāndhārī, Bhāṣāpatī, and Suvarṇanāsā.

original: rtsa dgu'i rim pa ni mig la sogs pa'i sgo dgu por gnas pa rnams so //
analyzed: rtsa dgu'i rim pa ni mig la sogs pa'i sgo dgu por gnas pa rnams so //
translated: The nine-channel stage is the ones located at the nine doors of the eyes and so on.🔽Worship with the yoga of that

original: ji lta ba'i sbyor bas mchod par bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji lta ba'i sbyor bas mchod par bya ba ni /
translated: is worship with the yoga of those [channels].

original: rtogs par byas la de'i gnas rnams su nges par bstan par bya'o ;
analyzed: rtogs par byas la de'i gnas rnams su nges par bstan par bya'o ;
translated: Having understood that, they should be taught in their locations.

original: ;'di'i thun mong ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: ;'di'i thun mong ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In order to teach their uniqueness, [the Bhagavān] declares,

original: 'di dag ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: these, etc.

original: 'di dag ces pa ni de ma thag tu gsungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di dag ces pa ni de ma thag tu gsungs pa nyid do //
translated: These are those just mentioned.

original: gsang ba zhes pa ni thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyis gsang ba'o //
analyzed: gsang ba zhes pa ni thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyis gsang ba'o //
translated: Secret is secret by virtue of being unique.

original: mchog ces pa ni rab mchog go //
analyzed: mchog ces pa ni rab mchog go //
translated: Supreme is excellent.

original: rnal 'byor zhes pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor zhes pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rnal 'byor ro //
translated: “Yoga” is the yoga of nondual samādhi.

original: bshad pa zhes pa ni rtsa'i rab tu dbye ba la sogs pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa zhes pa ni rtsa'i rab tu dbye ba la sogs pa bstan pa'o //
translated: “Explanation” is the teaching of the divisions of the nāḍīs, and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mi shes te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mi shes te /
translated: “The tathāgatas” are not known.

original: rdo rje bdud rtsi bstan pa'i don du dran pa'i lam du nye bar song ba med pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje bdud rtsi bstan pa'i don du dran pa'i lam du nye bar song ba med pa'o //
translated: “The meaning of the teaching of vajra amṛta” is not approached on the path of memory.

original: gang dang gang gis rnam par shes zhes pa la gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang dang gang gis rnam par shes zhes pa la gsungs pa /
translated: “By whom and by what” is stated:

original: sna tshogs zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: “Various” and so on.

original: sna tshogs ni don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs ni don yod grub pa'o //
translated: “Various” is Amoghasiddhi.

original: rnam par snang mdzad ni rab tu gnas par zad do //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad ni rab tu gnas par zad do //
translated: “Illuminator” is Akṣobhya.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni snang ba mtha' yas dang rin chen 'byung ldan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni snang ba mtha' yas dang rin chen 'byung ldan la sogs pa'o //
translated: “And so on” refers to Amitābha, Ratnasaṃbhava, and so on.

original: de rnams kyis rnam par mi shes pa'i don ni shes kyang gzhan dag la ma bstan zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de rnams kyis rnam par mi shes pa'i don ni shes kyang gzhan dag la ma bstan zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “they do not know” is that although they know, they do not teach others.

original: de lta bu'i cho gas gsol ba 'debs par byed pa med pas na'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i cho gas gsol ba 'debs par byed pa med pas na'o //
translated: Since there is no supplication with such a rite,

original: de lta bu'i cho gas de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa la sogs pa gdab pas gsol ba 'debs par byed pa yod na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i cho gas de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa la sogs pa gdab pas gsol ba 'debs par byed pa yod na /
translated: If there is one who makes a request by sprinkling the Tathagata and so forth with such a rite,

analyzed: bstan pa'i bye brag rnams bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the various teachings will be taught.

original: de bzhin du yang gsang ba 'dus pa las /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang gsang ba 'dus pa las /

original: ji srid mar me mdzad sogs kyis //
analyzed: ji srid mar me mdzad sogs kyis //

original: rgyud rnams bstan par ma gyur to //
analyzed: rgyud rnams bstan par ma gyur to //

original: zhes pa'o // de kho na nyid bsdus pa la sogs par rdo rje'i rigs can rnams rang gi yid la rjod par byed de /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de kho na nyid bsdus pa la sogs par rdo rje'i rigs can rnams rang gi yid la rjod par byed de /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa de gsungs so //🔽gal te tshul ji lta @73a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa de gsungs so // gal te tshul ji lta @73a * //

analyzed: ba bzhin ma rtogs na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis ma mkhyen pa dang ma gzigs pa cung zad kyang med do zhes pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //

original: gang zhig 'dir gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang zhig 'dir gsungs pa /

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis kyang de sgom par byed do zhes pa dang yang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis kyang de sgom par byed do zhes pa dang yang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
