translated: The peaceful, etc.

original: zhi ba'i thab khung ni zlum po'i rnam pa khru gang gi tshad du thig gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: zhi ba'i thab khung ni zlum po'i rnam pa khru gang gi tshad du thig gdab par bya'o //
translated: The peaceful hearth is of the form of a circle, and one should draw it with a measure of one cubit.

original: thig gdab nas zabs su brko ba ni khru phyed sa la zhes pa ni 'og gi zabs su brka ba'o //
analyzed: thig gdab nas zabs su brko ba ni khru phyed sa la zhes pa ni 'og gi zabs su brka ba'o //
translated: The half cubit is the depth of the pit.

original: kha dog dkar pos byug par bya //
analyzed: kha dog dkar pos byug par bya //
translated: One should smear it with white color,

original: @81a * // zhes pa ni tsandan dkar pos so //
analyzed: @81a * // zhes pa ni tsandan dkar pos so //
translated: that is, with white sandalwood.

original: logs zhes pa ni tshangs thig gi logs gnyis la ltos nas bdun pa'i gnyis pa'i tshig can bstan to //
analyzed: logs zhes pa ni tshangs thig gi logs gnyis la ltos nas bdun pa'i gnyis pa'i tshig can bstan to //
translated: The side is taught with the word second in reference to the two sides of the Brahma line.

original: 'khor ba'i rnam pa zhes pa ni zlum po sor bzhi'i kha khyer zhes par dgongs so //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rnam pa zhes pa ni zlum po sor bzhi'i kha khyer zhes par dgongs so //
translated: The form of a circle is intended as a rim four fingerbreadths around.

original: rgyas pa'i thab khung gsungs pa /
analyzed: rgyas pa'i thab khung gsungs pa /
translated: The pit for the prosperity rite is stated:

original: rgyas pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The prosperity pit, etc.

original: rgyas pa'i thab khung ni rgyang khru gnyis kyi tshad do //
analyzed: rgyas pa'i thab khung ni rgyang khru gnyis kyi tshad do //
translated: The prosperity pit is two cubits in size.

original: khru gang 'og tu brko ba'o //
analyzed: khru gang 'og tu brko ba'o //
translated: It is dug one cubit deep.

original: sor brgyad kyi kha khyer kun nas gru bzhir ro //
analyzed: sor brgyad kyi kha khyer kun nas gru bzhir ro //
translated: The rim is eight fingerbreadths all around and square.

original: btsag dang sindhu ra dang / btsag gi ming gis me tog ser po'i rigs kyi bye brag go //
analyzed: btsag dang sindhu ra dang / btsag gi ming gis me tog ser po'i rigs kyi bye brag go //
translated: Vermilion and sindūra are varieties of yellow flowers under the name vermilion.

original: btsag ser po zhes pas gzhan du de'i kha dog gis bri zhing sbyin sreg bya zhes so //
analyzed: btsag ser po zhes pas gzhan du de'i kha dog gis bri zhing sbyin sreg bya zhes so //
translated: The yellow ochre indicates that one should draw it with that color and perform the homa.

original: mngon spyod kyi thab khung gsungs pa /
analyzed: mngon spyod kyi thab khung gsungs pa /
translated: The pit for the rite of assault is stated:

original: mngon spyod ces pa la sogs pa'o //🔽mngon spyod kyi thab khung ni khru gsum rgyar sor mo nyi shu /
analyzed: mngon spyod ces pa la sogs pa'o // mngon spyod kyi thab khung ni khru gsum rgyar sor mo nyi shu /
translated: The pit for the rite of assault, etc.

original: zabs su sor mo bcu'o //
analyzed: zabs su sor mo bcu'o //
translated: The pit for the rite of assault is three cubits in width, twenty finger-breadths, and ten finger-breadths in depth.

original: sor mo gsum gyis kha khyer gyi phreng ba'o //
analyzed: sor mo gsum gyis kha khyer gyi phreng ba'o //
translated: The rim is three finger-breadths.

original: dur khrod kyi sol bas bri bar bya zhes pa'o ;
analyzed: dur khrod kyi sol bas bri bar bya zhes pa'o ;
translated: It should be drawn with charnel ground ash.

original: ; dbang dang dgug pa dag thun mong ste /
analyzed: ; dbang dang dgug pa dag thun mong ste /
translated: The rite of subjugation and the rite of summoning are common.

original: thab khung gi mtshan nyid dag gcig pu gsungs te /
analyzed: thab khung gi mtshan nyid dag gcig pu gsungs te /
translated: The characteristics of the pit are stated to be the same.

original: zla phyed ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zla phyed ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The pit for the rite of subjugation, etc.

original: zla ba phyed pa'i rnam pa lta bu rgyas pa'i hom khung gi tshad dang mnyam pa thab khung gi phyed kyi tshad kyi zabs su'o //
analyzed: zla ba phyed pa'i rnam pa lta bu rgyas pa'i hom khung gi tshad dang mnyam pa thab khung gi phyed kyi tshad kyi zabs su'o //
translated: The pit for the rite of subjugation is half a moon-shaped pit, equal in size to the pit for the rite of prosperity, and half the size of the pit for the rite of assault in depth.

original: tshad dang rjes su mthun nas kha sbyar bris nas kha dog dmar pos byug par bya'o //
analyzed: tshad dang rjes su mthun nas kha sbyar bris nas kha dog dmar pos byug par bya'o //
translated: Having made it equal in size, one should draw it and smear it with red color.

original: thab khung thams cad kyi dbus su rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du chu dang / sa dang / me dang / rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi steng du rtags dang bcas pa'i chos 'byung gi phyag rgya yang ji lta ba'i sbyor bas gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: thab khung thams cad kyi dbus su rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du chu dang / sa dang / me dang / rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi steng du rtags dang bcas pa'i chos 'byung gi phyag rgya yang ji lta ba'i sbyor bas gzhag par bya'o //
translated: In the center of all the hearths, one should place, in the proper order, the mudrā of the source of phenomena with its sign, on top of the maṇḍalas of water, earth, fire, and wind, by the proper application.

original: las rnams kyi don du phyogs kyi cha bstan pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: las rnams kyi don du phyogs kyi cha bstan pa gsungs pa /
translated: The directions for the parts of the directions for the sake of the rites are stated:

original: phyogs kyi cha rnams zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs kyi cha rnams zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The directions for the parts, etc.

original: phyogs kyi cha ni rab tu grags pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs kyi cha ni rab tu grags pa'o //
translated: The directions are well known.

original: me lha'i kha dog gi nges pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: me lha'i kha dog gi nges pa gsungs pa /
translated: The rule for the color of the fire god is stated:

original: mngon spyod ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon spyod ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: In the case of the rite of killing, etc.

original: mngon spyod ni mngon spyod kyi las rnams te /
analyzed: mngon spyod ni mngon spyod kyi las rnams te /
translated: The rite of killing is the rites of killing.

original: me lha la sogs pa'i kha dog nag por bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: me lha la sogs pa'i kha dog nag por bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the color of the fire god, etc., as black.

original: dbang la sogs pa'i kha dog bstan par 'dod nas kha dog lngas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dbang la sogs pa'i kha dog bstan par 'dod nas kha dog lngas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Desiring to teach the color for the rite of subjugation, etc., [the Bhagavān] declares, with the five colors, etc.

original: kha dog lnga yis dbang du bya //
analyzed: kha dog lnga yis dbang du bya //
translated: One should subjugate with the five colors.

original: zhes pa'i rdo rje tshig 'dis yi ge so sor phral ba'i nus pas kha dog lnga ni ser po dang dmar po dang dkar po'i kha dog @81b ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa'i rdo rje tshig 'dis yi ge so sor phral ba'i nus pas kha dog lnga ni ser po dang dmar po dang dkar po'i kha dog @81b ces pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the words of the vajra verse is that the five colors are yellow, red, and white, by the power of the individual letters.

original: las rnams la dmar po la sogs pa'i kha dog rnams gang zhe na zhes pa la /
analyzed: las rnams la dmar po la sogs pa'i kha dog rnams gang zhe na zhes pa la /
translated: What are the colors red and so forth for the rites?

original: na ba sa yig ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: na ba sa yig ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: [The colors] are stated by na, ba, and sa, and so forth.

original: na yig dang ba yig dang / sa yig gis dbang dang / rgyas pa dang / zhi ba brjod pas de'i rang bzhin du sbyor ro //
analyzed: na yig dang ba yig dang / sa yig gis dbang dang / rgyas pa dang / zhi ba brjod pas de'i rang bzhin du sbyor ro //
translated: By the na, ba, and sa letters, the colors red, yellow, and white are expressed, and they are applied to the nature of the rites of enthrallment, increase, and pacification, respectively.

original: na dang ba dang sa'i las zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: na dang ba dang sa'i las zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the rites of na, ba, and sa are red, yellow, and white, respectively.

original: de bzhin du yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang gsungs pa /
translated: Also, it is stated:

original: kab bya chen po zla ba'i 'od //
analyzed: kab bya chen po zla ba'i 'od //
translated: The great bird is the light of the moon.

original: yi ge so sor phral bas ni //
analyzed: yi ge so sor phral bas ni //
translated: By the individual letters,

original: pa yig padma r'a ga ste //
analyzed: pa yig padma r'a ga ste //
translated: the pa letter is ruby,

original: de bzhin na yig gser yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin na yig gser yin no //
translated: and likewise, the na letter is gold.

original: ca yig zla ba chu shel yin //
analyzed: ca yig zla ba chu shel yin //
translated: The ca letter is moon crystal.

original: kha dog kha dog nye bar bstan //
analyzed: kha dog kha dog nye bar bstan //
translated: The colors are taught to be colors.

original: na yig dbang gi ming can te //
analyzed: na yig dbang gi ming can te //
translated: The na letter is the name of enthrallment,

original: bha yig rgyas par brjod pa yin //
analyzed: bha yig rgyas par brjod pa yin //
translated: and the bha letter is said to be increase.

original: sa yig zhi bar shes par bya //
analyzed: sa yig zhi bar shes par bya //
translated: The letter Sa is to be known as peace.

original: kha dog dang ni las rnams brjod //
analyzed: kha dog dang ni las rnams brjod //
translated: The colors and the actions are described.

original: las kyi dbye bas sreg rdzas rnams bstan par 'dod nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: las kyi dbye bas sreg rdzas rnams bstan par 'dod nas gsungs pa /
translated: Desiring to teach the sacrificial substances by way of the division of actions, he says,

original: til dang 'bras zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: til dang 'bras zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Sesamum, rice, and so on.

original: til zhes pa ni ma grugs pa'i til lo //
analyzed: til zhes pa ni ma grugs pa'i til lo //
translated: Sesamum is unhusked sesamum.

original: 'bras ni s'a lu'o //
analyzed: 'bras ni s'a lu'o //
translated: Rice is śāli rice.

original: 'o ma dang mar ni pa'i'o //
analyzed: 'o ma dang mar ni pa'i'o //
translated: Milk and ghee are from a cow.

original: sbrang ni sbrang rtsi'o //
analyzed: sbrang ni sbrang rtsi'o //
translated: Honey is honey.

original: bdud rtsi lnga zhes pa ni dri chen dang dri chu dang khu ba dang khrag dang sha chen no //
analyzed: bdud rtsi lnga zhes pa ni dri chen dang dri chu dang khu ba dang khrag dang sha chen no //
translated: The five ambrosias are feces, urine, semen, blood, and human flesh.

original: sreg rdzas 'di rnams kyis rgyas pa dang / zhi ba la sreg blugs bya'o //
analyzed: sreg rdzas 'di rnams kyis rgyas pa dang / zhi ba la sreg blugs bya'o //
translated: With these sacrificial substances, one should make the burnt offerings for prosperity and peace.

original: mngon rdzogs kyi rdzas gsungs pa /
analyzed: mngon rdzogs kyi rdzas gsungs pa /
translated: He teaches the substances of the manifest perfect Buddha,

original: sreg rdzas dag ni thams cad kyis //
analyzed: sreg rdzas dag ni thams cad kyis //
translated: With all the sacrificial substances,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: and so on.

original: yam shing rnams kyang tsher ma dang mar khu tsha ba dang / kha ba la sogs pa'i shing kun las skyes pa sor mo bcu'i tshad kyis so //
analyzed: yam shing rnams kyang tsher ma dang mar khu tsha ba dang / kha ba la sogs pa'i shing kun las skyes pa sor mo bcu'i tshad kyis so //
translated: The sacrificial sticks are also produced from all the trees such as the thorny, the hot, and the bitter, and so on, and are ten fingerbreadths long.

original: dbang gi rdzas rnams kyi yam shing gsungs pa /
analyzed: dbang gi rdzas rnams kyi yam shing gsungs pa /
translated: The substances for the empowerment are the kindling.

original: 'o ma can gyi shing zhes 'o ma dang bcas pa'i shing pa ta dang / bim pa li dang / au du ma p'a ra la sogs pa'i shing la sor brgyad do //
analyzed: 'o ma can gyi shing zhes 'o ma dang bcas pa'i shing pa ta dang / bim pa li dang / au du ma p'a ra la sogs pa'i shing la sor brgyad do //
translated: The milky wood is the wood of the pāṭala, the bimbi, the udumbara, and so forth, eight fingerbreadths long.

original: dri zhim zhes pa ni sa la la ki dang / gu gul shing dang / kha di ra'i shing dang ngo //
analyzed: dri zhim zhes pa ni sa la la ki dang / gu gul shing dang / kha di ra'i shing dang ngo //
translated: The fragrant is the śallakī, the agallochum, and the khadira.

original: sbyin sreg gi cho ga'i gtor chog bya zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: sbyin sreg gi cho ga'i gtor chog bya zhes gsungs pa /
translated: The rite of the burnt offering is the rite of the sacrificial cake, as it is said.

original: kha zas zhes pa'o //
analyzed: kha zas zhes pa'o //
translated: The food is the sacrificial cake.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs zhes pa ni las kyi dbye bas zhi ba la zho dang / 'o ma dang / 'bras zan la sogs pa'i bza' ba mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs zhes pa ni las kyi dbye bas zhi ba la zho dang / 'o ma dang / 'bras zan la sogs pa'i bza' ba mdzes pa'o //
translated: The various is the beautiful food of curd, milk, rice, and so forth for the pacifying,

original: rgyas pa la mar dang 'o ma dang sbrang rtsi dang sha dang ro zhim pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa la mar dang 'o ma dang sbrang rtsi dang sha dang ro zhim pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: the ghee, milk, honey, meat, and delicious flavors and so forth for the enriching,

original: khro ba la ni tsha ba dang / la phug dang / tshva la sogs pa legs par sbyar te bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: khro ba la ni tsha ba dang / la phug dang / tshva la sogs pa legs par sbyar te bza' bar bya'o //
translated: and the pungent, the radish, the salt, and so forth well combined for the wrathful.

original: dbang la mar dang sha chang dang / 'bras bu dang / sha kha ra la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang la mar dang sha chang dang / 'bras bu dang / sha kha ra la sogs pa'o //
translated: For the empowerment, there is butter, meat, beer, fruit, sugar, and so on.

original: @82a * // gtor ma zhes pa ni lha bshos so //
analyzed: @82a * // gtor ma zhes pa ni lha bshos so //
translated: The bali is the cake offering.

original: sbyin sreg gi lhag pa'i lha rnams dang / 'byung bo'i gtor ma dang / 'byung po rnams gsungs pa /
analyzed: sbyin sreg gi lhag pa'i lha rnams dang / 'byung bo'i gtor ma dang / 'byung po rnams gsungs pa /
translated: The remaining deities of the fire sacrifice, the bali for the bhūtas, and the bhūtas are mentioned.

original: kun zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kun zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The verse beginning all and so on.

original: 'byung po kun zhes pa ni 'bras dang / sran ma dang / tshva la sogs pa mar khus bsres nas brgya byin dang / me lha dang / gshin rje dang / srin po dang / chu bdag dang / rlung lha dang / gnod sbyin dang /
analyzed: 'byung po kun zhes pa ni 'bras dang / sran ma dang / tshva la sogs pa mar khus bsres nas brgya byin dang / me lha dang / gshin rje dang / srin po dang / chu bdag dang / rlung lha dang / gnod sbyin dang /
translated: The all bhūtas are rice, beans, barley, and so on, mixed with ghee, and offered to Indra, Agni, Yama, Rākṣasa, Varuṇa, Vāyu, Yakṣa,

original: dbang ldan la sogs pa la sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang ldan la sogs pa la sbyin par bya'o //
translated: and so on.

original: gtor ma de yang he ru ka'i phyag rgyas sbyin par bya zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: gtor ma de yang he ru ka'i phyag rgyas sbyin par bya zhes gsungs pa /
translated: And that bali is to be given with the mudra of Heruka, as it is said:

original: he ru ka zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: he ru ka zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The verse beginning Heruka and so on.

original: he ru ka'i rnal 'byor gyi sngags gang zhig he ru ka'i phyag rgyar brjod pa ni he ru ka'i sngags kyis zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: he ru ka'i rnal 'byor gyi sngags gang zhig he ru ka'i phyag rgyar brjod pa ni he ru ka'i sngags kyis zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The mantra of Heruka yoga that is called the mudra of Heruka is the meaning of with the mantra of Heruka.

original: gang cung zad ces pa ni rtag par gtor ma gus pas chu dang bsres nas sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gang cung zad ces pa ni rtag par gtor ma gus pas chu dang bsres nas sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Whatever is offered should be given with respect, mixed with water.

original: sgrub pa pos ni de yang he ru ka'i phyag rgya nyid do //
analyzed: sgrub pa pos ni de yang he ru ka'i phyag rgya nyid do //
translated: And that is also the seal of Heruka for the adept.

original: des cir 'gyur zhes pa la gsungs pa 'grub ces pa'o //
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhes pa la gsungs pa 'grub ces pa'o //
translated: What will happen by that? It is said, “accomplishment.”

original: de ltar rnal 'byor ba rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de ltar rnal 'byor ba rnams kyis so //
translated: Thus, by the yogis.

original: yid la ci 'dod pa ni phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid la ci 'dod pa ni phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever is desired in the mind will be perfect.

original: zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rnams kyi dus bstan pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa'o //🔽ston gyi dus ni ston zla 'bring po'i tha chungs so //
analyzed: zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rnams kyi dus bstan pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa'o // ston gyi dus ni ston zla 'bring po'i tha chungs so //
translated: The time for the rites of pacification, etc. is taught by “pacification, etc.”🔽The autumn season is the last month of autumn.

original: dgun ni dgun zla ra ba dang 'bring po'o //
analyzed: dgun ni dgun zla ra ba dang 'bring po'o //
translated: Winter is the first and middle months of winter.

original: dpyid ni dpyid zla ra ba dang 'bring po'o //
analyzed: dpyid ni dpyid zla ra ba dang 'bring po'o //
translated: Spring is the first and middle months of spring.

original: ci dus 'di thams cad du rtag par sbyin sreg bya ba'am zhe na /
analyzed: ci dus 'di thams cad du rtag par sbyin sreg bya ba'am zhe na /
translated: Should the burnt offering always be performed at all times of these?

original: ma yin par gsungs pa /🔽snga dro thun gcig ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin par gsungs pa / snga dro thun gcig ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is said, “No.”🔽The morning, etc.

original: snga bar zhes pa ni nyi ma gzhan ni thun mtshams lhag ma rnams ni go sla'o //
analyzed: snga bar zhes pa ni nyi ma gzhan ni thun mtshams lhag ma rnams ni go sla'o //
translated: The morning is the first part of the day. The other times are easy to understand.

original: sbyin sreg la sogs pa'i lha rnams rdzogs nas sngags bstan pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: sbyin sreg la sogs pa'i lha rnams rdzogs nas sngags bstan pa gsungs pa /
translated: Having completed the deities of the fire sacrifice and so forth, he teaches the mantra.

original: h'um yig gis zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: h'um yig gis zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The letter HŪṀ, etc.

original: h'um yig ni 'dir rang gi lus la bskul ba'i dbye ba las thams cad par bzhed do //
analyzed: h'um yig ni 'dir rang gi lus la bskul ba'i dbye ba las thams cad par bzhed do //
translated: The letter HŪṀ is accepted here as all-purpose, from the division of its application to one's own body.

original: des lta gzhan rnams rdzogs par byas nas sreg blugs sbyin par bya zhes par 'brel to //
analyzed: des lta gzhan rnams rdzogs par byas nas sreg blugs sbyin par bya zhes par 'brel to //
translated: Having completed the other views with that, one should offer the oblation, is the connection.

original: gang du rdzogs par bya zhes pa la 'brel pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang du rdzogs par bya zhes pa la 'brel pa gsungs pa /
translated: Where should one complete it? He teaches the connection:

original: thab khung dbus su zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thab khung dbus su zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: In the middle of the hearth, etc.

original: thab khung dbus ni sngon du gsungs pa'i zhi ba la sogs pa'i thab khung ste /
analyzed: thab khung dbus ni sngon du gsungs pa'i zhi ba la sogs pa'i thab khung ste /
translated: The middle of the hearth is the hearth of pacification, etc., previously taught.

original: shing skam po las me 'bar ba'i dbus su'o //
analyzed: shing skam po las me 'bar ba'i dbus su'o //
translated: In the middle of the blazing fire from dry wood.

original: rang gi lha zhes pa ni 'dod pa'i lha rnams so //🔽las rnam pa gsum la ni rdo rje bdud rtsis so //
analyzed: rang gi lha zhes pa ni 'dod pa'i lha rnams so // las rnam pa gsum la ni rdo rje bdud rtsis so //
translated: One's deity is the desired deities.🔽For the three kinds of rites, with the vajra nectar.

original: mngon spyod ni rje btsun gshin rjes so //
analyzed: mngon spyod ni rje btsun gshin rjes so //
translated: In the case of the rite of assault, with the revered Yāmin.

original: de la zhi ba la kha dog dkar po'o //
analyzed: de la zhi ba la kha dog dkar po'o //
translated: There, in the case of pacification, the color is white.

original: zhal gsum @82b ni dkar po dang / nag po dang / nyi ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhal gsum @82b ni dkar po dang / nag po dang / nyi ma lta bu'o //
translated: The three faces are white, black, and sun-like.

original: phyag drug ni 'khor lo dang / rdo rje dang / ral gri dang / lcags kyu dang / zhags pa dang / dril bu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: phyag drug ni 'khor lo dang / rdo rje dang / ral gri dang / lcags kyu dang / zhags pa dang / dril bu 'dzin pa'o //

analyzed: rdo rje bdud rtsi cod pan gyi bdud rtsi bsgom par bya'o //

analyzed: rdo rje bdud rtsi cod pan la sogs pa rdzogs par bya'o //

analyzed: mngon spyod la ni gshin rje kha dog nag po //

analyzed: zhal gsum ni nag po dang / dkar po dang nyi ma lta bu'o //

analyzed: rdo rje bdud rtsi cod pan du bsten par bya'o //

analyzed: sbyin sreg 'bum phrag gcig gis rab tu 'grub ces gsungs pa /

original: lha bskyed la dgug par bya'o //
analyzed: lha bskyed la dgug par bya'o //

analyzed: mngon spyod kyi me lha ni kha dog nag po ste /
translated: The fire god for the rite of assault is black.

analyzed: zhal gsum ni nag po dang / dkar po dang / nyi ma lta bu'o //
translated: The three faces are black, white, and sun-like.

analyzed: phyag drug ni ral gri dang / rdo rje dang / 'khor lo dang / zhags pa dang / dril bu dang / ril ba rnams kyis brel ba'o //

original: mar khu chen po zhes pa ni mar khu ba chen po dang bcas pas dur khrod kyi ras la byas pa'i sdong bu ste gang du thod pa mi'i mgo bo yin pa de ni de bzhin te /
analyzed: mar khu chen po zhes pa ni mar khu ba chen po dang bcas pas dur khrod kyi ras la byas pa'i sdong bu ste gang du thod pa mi'i mgo bo yin pa de ni de bzhin te /
translated: Great oil is the wick of a human corpse cloth, since it is accompanied by great oil. Where the skull is the head of a human, that is just so.

original: nag po'i tshes brgyad dang bcu bzhi'i nub mo dur khrod du thod pa gsum gyi steng du mar khu chen po'i mar me'i snod kyi thod pa bzhag ste /
analyzed: nag po'i tshes brgyad dang bcu bzhi'i nub mo dur khrod du thod pa gsum gyi steng du mar khu chen po'i mar me'i snod kyi thod pa bzhag ste /
translated: On the night of the eighth or fourteenth of the dark fortnight in a charnel ground, having placed a skull bowl on three skulls, place the vessel of the great oil lamp on that.

original: de'i steng du bud med kyi thod pas kha bkab nas mig sman blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de'i steng du bud med kyi thod pas kha bkab nas mig sman blang bar bya ste /
translated: Having covered it with the skull of a woman, one should take the eye medicine.

original: de la 'ug pa'i mgo bo bsregs nas khrag chen pos lan mang du bsnos te /
analyzed: de la 'ug pa'i mgo bo bsregs nas khrag chen pos lan mang du bsnos te /
translated: Having burned the head of an owl there, one should wash it many times with great blood.

original: de nyid kyi nub mo rdo'i gdan la yang dag par btags nas phye ma 'jam zhing zhib par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi nub mo rdo'i gdan la yang dag par btags nas phye ma 'jam zhing zhib par bya'o //
translated: Having applied it to a stone seat that very night, one should make it into fine, smooth powder.

original: mig sman dang bcas par gcig tu bsdus nas bya rgod kyi rkang pa'i pags par gtum pa'am /
analyzed: mig sman dang bcas par gcig tu bsdus nas bya rgod kyi rkang pa'i pags par gtum pa'am /
translated: Having collected together the eye medicine and so forth, one should grind it on the skin of a vulture's foot,

original: bya rgod kyi rkang pa'i rus pa'i sbu gu gang zhing bsgrub par bya zhes par 'brel to //
analyzed: bya rgod kyi rkang pa'i rus pa'i sbu gu gang zhing bsgrub par bya zhes par 'brel to //
translated: or fill a tube with the bone of a vulture's foot, and one should accomplish it.

original: gang dang gang gi snying po dang bcas pa de dang des ni 'grub ste /
analyzed: gang dang gang gi snying po dang bcas pa de dang des ni 'grub ste /
translated: Whatever one's essence, that one will accomplish.

original: mig sman gyis bdag nyid la'am gzhan gyi mig la byug par bya ste /
analyzed: mig sman gyis bdag nyid la'am gzhan gyi mig la byug par bya ste /
translated: With the eye medicine, one should anoint oneself or the eyes of another.

original: mi rus kyi thur mas so //
analyzed: mi rus kyi thur mas so //
translated: With the spoon of human bone.

original: de dang de'i gzugs kun byed do //
analyzed: de dang de'i gzugs kun byed do //
translated: One should make all forms of that and that.🔽There,

original: de la ; mig sman ji ltar bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: de la ; mig sman ji ltar bsgrub par bya //
translated: how should one accomplish the eye medicine?

original: zhes pa la gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa la gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: mig sman zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mig sman zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The eye medicine and so forth.

original: mig sman ni sngon du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: mig sman ni sngon du gsungs pa'o //
translated: The eye medicine is as previously stated.

original: gang zhig sngags dang sman gyi sbyor bas legs par sbyor ba ni sbyor bas 'grub ces brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig sngags dang sman gyi sbyor bas legs par sbyor ba ni sbyor bas 'grub ces brjod pa'o //
translated: That which is well prepared by the combination of mantra and medicine is said to be accomplished by combination.

original: rdo rje bdud rtsi las byung ba zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rdo rje bdud rtsi las byung ba zhes pa ni /
translated: Arisen from the vajra nectar means

original: rdo rje bdud rtsi rgyud kyi rim pa'i gzhung gi bha ga'i dbus su bsgrub par bya zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rdo rje bdud rtsi rgyud kyi rim pa'i gzhung gi bha ga'i dbus su bsgrub par bya zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: In the middle of the bhaga, one should say, one should accomplish according to the text of the Vajra Amṛta Tantra.

original: thog mar phyag rgya byin gyis brlabs shing /
analyzed: thog mar phyag rgya byin gyis brlabs shing /
translated: First, one should consecrate the consort,

original: phyi nas mig sman gyi sgrub thabs dang yang dag par spyod pas gzhug cing bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi nas mig sman gyi sgrub thabs dang yang dag par spyod pas gzhug cing bsgom par bya'o //
translated: and afterwards, with the eye ointment practice and conduct, one should enter and meditate.

original: ji srid dngos grub kyi mtshan ma 'byung bar zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ji srid dngos grub kyi mtshan ma 'byung bar zhes pa'o //
translated: As long as the signs of accomplishment arise, one should do this.

original: snying po dang bral ba'i sman 'di gcig pus zhi ba la sogs pa la yang byed ces gsungs pa /
analyzed: snying po dang bral ba'i sman 'di gcig pus zhi ba la sogs pa la yang byed ces gsungs pa /
translated: This medicine, devoid of essence, is said to be used for pacification and so forth.

original: zhi ba zhes pa la sogs pa'o //🔽mig sman gyis mig la byugs te zhi ba la sogs pa'i lta stangs kyis bltas na zhi ba la sogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhi ba zhes pa la sogs pa'o // mig sman gyis mig la byugs te zhi ba la sogs pa'i lta stangs kyis bltas na zhi ba la sogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Pacification, and so forth.🔽By applying the eye ointment and gazing with the pacification and so forth gazes, there will be pacification and so forth.

original: gza' la sogs pas bzung ba rnams la @84b mig sman gyis byugs na gza' la sogs pa 'joms par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gza' la sogs pas bzung ba rnams la @84b mig sman gyis byugs na gza' la sogs pa 'joms par 'gyur ro //
translated: For those seized by planets and so forth, if they apply the eye ointment, the planets and so forth will be destroyed.

original: mig la mig sman gyis byugs te rgyal po la bltas na rgyal po'i mchod pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig la mig sman gyis byugs te rgyal po la bltas na rgyal po'i mchod pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one looks at the king with one's eyes anointed with eye medicine, one will obtain the king's worship.

original: mig la mig sman gyis byugs te khro ba'i lta bas dgra rnams la bltas na dgra rnams brlag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig la mig sman gyis byugs te khro ba'i lta bas dgra rnams la bltas na dgra rnams brlag par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one looks at one's enemies with one's eyes anointed with eye medicine and with an angry look, one's enemies will be destroyed.

original: de bzhin du bgegs rnams la bltas na bgegs thams cad skrod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du bgegs rnams la bltas na bgegs thams cad skrod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, if one looks at the obstructors, all obstructors will be expelled.🔽One should anoint one's eyes with eye medicine and recite the mantra to be stated, one should anoint one's eyes with eye medicine and recite the mantra to be stated.

original: dang po'i zhal ni nag po zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dang po'i zhal ni nag po zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The mantra is stated as one should anoint one's eyes with eye medicine and recite the mantra to be stated.🔽 The

original: bdag ma'i kha dog dang mtshan ma rnams sba'o //
analyzed: bdag ma'i kha dog dang mtshan ma rnams sba'o //
translated: The color and signs of the consort are concealed.

original: bha ga'i dbus su zhes pa ni bha ga nyid ni phyag rgya'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: bha ga'i dbus su zhes pa ni bha ga nyid ni phyag rgya'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: In the middle of the bhaga, the bhaga itself is the maṇḍala of the consort.

original: bsgrub par bya zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya zhes pa ni /
translated: One should practice,

original: rmi lam gyi mtshan ma'i bar du'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi mtshan ma'i bar du'o zhes pa'o //
translated: until the signs of the dream.

original: thig le'i rnal 'byor gyi sgrub thabs su gsungs pa /
analyzed: thig le'i rnal 'byor gyi sgrub thabs su gsungs pa /
translated: In the sādhana of the bindu yoga,

original: gur gum zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gur gum zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: it is said, “saffron,” and so on.

original: bha ga'i rnam pa zhes pa ni bud med kyi skye gnas su gur gum bcug ste /
analyzed: bha ga'i rnam pa zhes pa ni bud med kyi skye gnas su gur gum bcug ste /
translated: The form of the bhaga is the female organ, into which saffron is placed.

original: phyi nas sgrub thabs 'di la zhugs te kha sbyor gyi rnal 'byor gyis sngags bzlas shing bsgrub par bya zhes pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: phyi nas sgrub thabs 'di la zhugs te kha sbyor gyi rnal 'byor gyis sngags bzlas shing bsgrub par bya zhes pa lhag ma'o //
translated: Later, having entered this sādhana, one should practice with the mantra recitation of the yoga of union. The rest is self-evident.

original: de la sngags bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /🔽aom yig dbyangs kyis phye ba zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la sngags bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa / aom yig dbyangs kyis phye ba zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: In order to teach the mantra there, it is said,🔽“the syllable oṃ divided by the vowels,” and so on.

original: dbyangs kyis phye zhes pa ni dbyangs rnams ni aa yig la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: dbyangs kyis phye zhes pa ni dbyangs rnams ni aa yig la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: “ Divided by the vowels” means the vowels are the syllables a and so on.

original: phye ba ni char te gnyis pa dbyangs ring po'i bdag nyid ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: phye ba ni char te gnyis pa dbyangs ring po'i bdag nyid ces pa'i don to //
translated: The division is the rain, the meaning of the second, “endowed with long vowels.”

original: aom yig dang dbyangs kyi dbye ba ni aom yig dbyangs kyis phye pa ste /
analyzed: aom yig dang dbyangs kyi dbye ba ni aom yig dbyangs kyis phye pa ste /
translated: The division of the letter Oṃ is the division of the letter Oṃ by the vowels.

original: de nyid ni dngos por yod pa gang yin pa de ni aom yig dbyangs kyis phye ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni dngos por yod pa gang yin pa de ni aom yig dbyangs kyis phye ba'o //
translated: That which exists as a thing is the division of the letter Oṃ by the vowels.

original: aom aa mri ta zhes brjod par bya zhes pa ni 'di rnams kyi de ma thag tu aa mri ta zhes pa'i yi ge gsum po bri bar bya zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: aom aa mri ta zhes brjod par bya zhes pa ni 'di rnams kyi de ma thag tu aa mri ta zhes pa'i yi ge gsum po bri bar bya zhes pa'i don to //
translated: One should say the letter Oṃ amṛta—the meaning is that immediately after these, one should write the three letters amṛta.

original: de nas phat yig go //
analyzed: de nas phat yig go //
translated: Then the letter phaṭ.

original: phat yig gi de ma thag tu sprin gyi sgra sgrogs pa ni h'um yig go //
analyzed: phat yig gi de ma thag tu sprin gyi sgra sgrogs pa ni h'um yig go //
translated: Immediately after the letter phaṭ, the sound of the roaring of clouds is the letter hūṃ.

original: aa mri ta yis mnyam par ldan //🔽/ zhes @85a * //
analyzed: aa mri ta yis mnyam par ldan // / zhes @85a * //
translated: Endowed with amṛta.

original: pa ni aa mri ta ni tam yig go //
analyzed: pa ni aa mri ta ni tam yig go //
translated: The amṛta is the letter ta.

original: des ldan zhing mthar sv'a h'a yang ngo //🔽aom a'a a'i a'u r'i l'i /
analyzed: des ldan zhing mthar sv'a h'a yang ngo // aom a'a a'i a'u r'i l'i /
translated: Endowed with that, and at the end, also svāhā.🔽Oṃ ā ī ū ṝ ḷ ai au aḥ amṛta phaṭ hūṃ ha svāhā.

original: aee aoo aa: aa mri ta phat h'um ha sv'a h'a rnam gang du btu zhes pa la gsungs pa /
analyzed: aee aoo aa: aa mri ta phat h'um ha sv'a h'a rnam gang du btu zhes pa la gsungs pa /
translated: As for the question, “In what order should they be written?” it is said:

original: bha ga'i dbus su zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bha ga'i dbus su zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: In the middle of the bhaga, etc.

original: tsandan gyis bha ga rnam par byugs nas der btu zhes pa ni bri bar bya zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: tsandan gyis bha ga rnam par byugs nas der btu zhes pa ni bri bar bya zhes dgongs so //
translated: Having anointed the bhaga with sandalwood, one should draw it there. The thought is that one should draw it.

original: btus nas ci zhig bya zhes pa la gsungs pa /
analyzed: btus nas ci zhig bya zhes pa la gsungs pa /
translated: Having drawn it, what should one do?

original: bzlas pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste sngon du bsnyen pa 'bum phrag gcig bzlas nas phyis mig sman sgrub pa bzhin du gur gum yang zhes gsungs par gyur pas so //
analyzed: bzlas pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste sngon du bsnyen pa 'bum phrag gcig bzlas nas phyis mig sman sgrub pa bzhin du gur gum yang zhes gsungs par gyur pas so //
translated: It is said, “repeating,” etc. Having previously repeated one hundred thousand times, later one should also do saffron, as it is said.

original: des dpral bar thig le bya zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: des dpral bar thig le bya zhes gsungs pa /
translated: It is said that one should make a drop on the forehead with that.

original: thig le zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thig le zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: A drop, etc.

original: thig le ni 'bras bu ste go sla'o //
analyzed: thig le ni 'bras bu ste go sla'o //
translated: A drop is a fruit, easy to understand.

original: smyo bar byed pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: smyo bar byed pa gsungs pa /
translated: It is said that one should cause madness.

original: dha du ra la zhes pa la sogs pa ste gser shing gi sa bon no //
analyzed: dha du ra la zhes pa la sogs pa ste gser shing gi sa bon no //
translated: The seed of the golden plant, etc.

original: khu bas lan mang du bsnos te sha chen dang mnyam par ldan pa la gshin rje'i sngags brgyad brgya bzlas pa byas nas chang dang bcas par gang la byin pa de ni smyon par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khu bas lan mang du bsnos te sha chen dang mnyam par ldan pa la gshin rje'i sngags brgyad brgya bzlas pa byas nas chang dang bcas par gang la byin pa de ni smyon par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having repeatedly soaked it in juice, having made it equal to human flesh, having done the repetition eight hundred times of the mantra of Yamarāja, one should give it with beer to whomever, and he will become insane.

original: phyis skams nas 'chi'o //
analyzed: phyis skams nas 'chi'o //
translated: Later, when it dries up, one dies.

original: de la gshin rje mthar byed kyi sngags gsungs pa /
analyzed: de la gshin rje mthar byed kyi sngags gsungs pa /
translated: There, the mantra of Yama, the destroyer, is stated:

original: aom hr'i: shtri wi kri t'a na na zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: aom hr'i: shtri wi kri t'a na na zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Om hriḥ śrī vikṛtānana namaḥ, etc.

original: bud med rnams rjes su chags par byed pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: bud med rnams rjes su chags par byed pa gsungs pa /
translated: The statement of the enchantment of women is:

original: go ro tsa na zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: go ro tsa na zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Gorochana, etc.

original: de gsungs par gyur pa tsandan gyis nye bar byugs pa'i bha ga'i steng du go ro tsa nas bhr'um yig yang dag par bri ba ni rje bo dang bcas par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de gsungs par gyur pa tsandan gyis nye bar byugs pa'i bha ga'i steng du go ro tsa nas bhr'um yig yang dag par bri ba ni rje bo dang bcas par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: That is stated. On the bhaga anointed with sandalwood, one should write the syllable bhruṃ with gorochana, together with the lord.

original: ji srid myos byed 'gro ba de bzhin du rje bo bran bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji srid myos byed 'gro ba de bzhin du rje bo bran bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: As long as the intoxicant moves, the lord becomes like a servant.

original: bsad pa'i rab tu sbyor ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: bsad pa'i rab tu sbyor ba gsungs pa /
translated: The statement of the practice of killing is:

original: dri chen dri chu zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dri chen dri chu zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Shit, urine, etc.

original: dri chen dang dri chu la dgra bo'i gzugs brnyan byas la mi rus kyi phye ma dang mi'i skras dkri bar bya zhing sha chen gyis bdug par byas nas gshin rje'i sngags brgyad brgya bzlas so //
analyzed: dri chen dang dri chu la dgra bo'i gzugs brnyan byas la mi rus kyi phye ma dang mi'i skras dkri bar bya zhing sha chen gyis bdug par byas nas gshin rje'i sngags brgyad brgya bzlas so //
translated: Having made an effigy of the enemy out of feces and urine, one should wrap it with human bone ash and human hair, fumigate it with human flesh, and recite the mantra of Yama eight hundred times.

original: de nas dgra bo'i khyim gyi sgo der gzugs brnyan brkos nas gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dgra bo'i khyim gyi sgo der gzugs brnyan brkos nas gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Then, having carved an effigy of the enemy, one should place it at the door of the enemy's house.

original: nyi ma bdun gyi nang du dgra bo de 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyi ma bdun gyi nang du dgra bo de 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Within seven days, that enemy will die.

original: yang na sbyin sreg gis gsang bar bya zhes gsungs pa la /
analyzed: yang na sbyin sreg gis gsang bar bya zhes gsungs pa la /
translated: Alternatively, it is said that one should perform the secret burnt offering.

original: dri chen dri chu khrag dag ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dri chen dri chu khrag dag ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: With feces, urine, and blood, and so on.
